text: 12 ounce bottle. Nice creamy caramel notes with a strong smoothness. Sweetness but not too much. Dried fruit.
Mørk brun lett tåkete med lavt beige skum. Lukter svisker, kandis og trevirke. Fyldig. Søt kandis, brent karamell, toast og svisker. Middels lang.
Bottle. Very intense and complex beer. So much going on. Quite enjoyed it - good beer

Data butelkowania:  30.11.2016 
 Kolor:  Miedziany z czerwonymi refleksami. Mocne zamglenie na całej powierzchni szkła. 
 Piana:  Żółta praktycznie o każdej możliwej strukturze. Najpierw drobna, potem pęka do dużych i średnich baniek, aby na koniec zredukować się do milimetrowej obrączki. 
Całkiem okazałe wzorki na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest mało intensywny. Trzeba się bardzo natrudzić, żeby w ogóle cokolwiek tutaj wywąchać. Górują w nim słody. Mało wyraźne nuty korzenne pomieszane z wysoką przyprawowością.
Jest też sporo belgijskich drożdży.
Mało owocowych akcentów, praktycznie w ogóle.
Delikatny karmel w tle. 
 Smak:  W smaku solidnie przyprawowe i korzenne na zmianę. Mamy tutaj sporo nut goździków, gałki muszkatowej i pieprzu.
Delikatny karmel miesza się z akcentami ziemistymi i nutami ciemnego chleba.
Piwo jest solidnie gorzkie, co tak na prawdę jest nowością jak dla mnie w tym stylu.
Opisanych na etykiecie nut czekoladowych nie odnajduje tutaj wcale. Dostrzegam za to nieźle ułożony alkohol.
Piwo jest bardzo oryginalne jak na swój styl, zupełnie niespotykane jak do tej pory.
Teksturę ma całkiem fajną, chociaż daleką od oleistego trunku. 
Czy mi smakuje? Trudno to określić...Raz tak, raz nie. 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie, a nawet wysokie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Jeden z najbardziej oryginalnych i kontrowersyjnych Quadów jakie piłem. Naszprycowany nutami przyprawowymi (goździki, pieprz, gałka muszkatołowa).
Mocno korzenny, ziemisty i tylko z lekkim przełamaniem karmelowym. Wspaniale ukryty alkohol. Brakuje mi w nim nut owocowych i odrobiny więcej słodyczy.
Dla poszukiwaczy ciekawych wersji tego stylu może być nie lada gadką :)

Red berries and a little spice in the smell. Yeast, some alcohol, red berries and a little sweet taste. Not so good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Not a good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Primo: czym sie kurde rozni Abt od Quadrupla?
Secundo: Zabutelkowany 30 listopada 2016, czyli swiezy
Tertio: Bardzo fajny aromat owocowy, w roznych formach - suszonych (zwlaszcza rodzynki, ale tez jakies sliwkowe suszone a nawet wisniowe skojarzenia), swiezych, moze nieco przejrzalych (morele, brzoskwinie, moze nawet banany?), na cieplo jeszcze w tle wychodza kandyzowane figi (mrau) i migdalowe jakies klimaty, nieco karmelu, troche przyprawowosci pieprzowo-gozdzikowej, slad czekolady. W ustach polslodki (im cieplej tym bardziej slodki sie wydaje), nieco (ale tylko nieco niestety) syropowa konsystencja, bardzo wysoko wysycony, w odbiorze w porownaniu do aromatu wiecej jakichs ziolowo-przyprawowo-ziemistych nutek. Alkohol jednoznacznie odczuwalny, ale nie przeszkadzajacy. Pojawia sie tez ciut kwaskowatosci takiej cytrynowejZ jednej strony pilem duzo bardziej mi pasujacych quadrupli, ale z drugiej strony ten jest dosc unikalny - w odroznieniu od konkurencji jest bardzo lekki w odbiorze, bardzo pijalny - mimo zlozonosci. Jest tez ciut agresywny, ale to chyba glownie przez przyprawowosc w polaczeniu z dzika iloscia co2. BDB+
Bottle @ home split a few ways. Amber pour with a small head. Notes of warming alcohol, prunes, caramel, some sweet pears and light oak.
Strong beer, a bit too strong for my taste as the flavours are overpowered by the alcohol. Yet, a good beer from DDC.

I am not dead yet. And I want more! Pure pleasure to enjoy beer like this.Transparent dark color with a fine thick tan head. Good lacing and a solid aroma. Medium to full body and a smooth carbonation level. Oily texture and a nice balanced sweetness. Good lasting flavor with candy sugar, dried fruits, banana, almonds and toffee. Dangerously well masked alcohol.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]

Schiuma poco persistente, colore ambrato scuro, aroma vaniglia, malto, lievito, prugna. Al palato uvetta e vaniglia, corpo medio, leggero finale metallico, un po aspra. Una abt particolare più verso le strong ale belghe che alle quadrupel trappiste.
Flaska från SB. Brun med beige skum. Lätt syrlig dov doft. Halvsöt smak med karamell.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2017 Pours orange/brown with off-white head. Aroma is caramel, some sugar, wooden, cinnamon, leather, spices, vanilla, some cookies, wafer. Taste is caramel, cinnamon, cookies, some alcohol, spices, some sourness, raisin, earth, some chocolate. Superb beer!

Pours mahogany brown with white foam. Nose is chocolate, nougat, hazelnuts, butter. Very nice and balanced mouthfeel, full bodied with a surprisingly nutty finish! Really interesting! Chocolate and fried fruits like plums also appearing. A wonerful long zipper!

from bottle, poured a chesnut brown colour with a light tanned head. nose of caramel malts, riped fruits, raisins, sweeet cacao notes, caramel and raisins. taste of earthy fruits, caramel, prunes and sticky sweetness. full bodied. enjoyable. close to the belgian top tiers abts

Slightly hazy dark cobber with light brown head. Aroma has lots of fruit esters (banana, apple), notes of dried fruits (prunes, raisins etc), malty notes of caramel and bread and lots of alcohol. Nice complexity. The taste is medium to heavy sweet, slightly acidic and very lightly bitter. Flavor has notes of dried fruits and toffee. Lots of flavor and complexity. I like it.

1 year in the cellar : Deeply clouded and murky reddish brown color with good activity and a floating mist of yeast. Faint creamy light brown 1 finger head, lasting around 2 minutes, with a swirl it makes decent legs. Flavors of prunes, plums, cherries, raisins, walnuts, dark roasted grains, molasses, caramel, coffee, cocoa, wood, herbal spices. Thick and rich dark fruity sugary feel, appetizer like, yet with a sharp spicy and malty sensation. Slick and smooth medium body with almost champagne like carbonation, highly crispy. Very strong finish, vinous and port like, pleasant dark fruits with burnt malts, sharp earthy spices and yeast, with notes of peppercorn and oak. I can almost directly taste the barrel. Not excessively dry and heavy like most Quads, more leaning towards a barley wine feel. Incredible taste, balance, and intensity. Highly complex with tons of rich flavors. Highly warming and still a bit fresh. Overall exquisite quality craft. Probably the best one from DDC, truly my favorite one form them until now, the hype is real. I can rarely drink a whole bottle of quad by myself, but this time it was so easy.

Bottle from Systembolaget, cellared for about a year. Pours dark copper brown with a faint beige head. Aroma and taste of dates, figs, light nuttiness. Dried plum, clean dark caramel. Smooth and creamy texture. Pretty nice overall with a slight tint of booze.

Bottle @ home. Cellared for two years. Dark copper to brown color with medium head. Aroma is sweet and fruity with red fruits, intense caramel, dark syrup, herbs, spices, raisins, plums and milk chocolate. Taste has sweet red fruits, dark syrup, deep caramel, plums, wood, milk chocolate. Body is medium to big. High carbonation, a bit sticky. Finish is drier and smooth with lingering port wine like fruitiness. Nicely balanced.

Chocolatey aroma with plum and booze. Amber color with lots of sediment in the pour. Sweeter than most quads with rich dark fruit flavor, plum and oak. Slight booze burn aftertaste. Good smooth palate. This was really good.

Aroma is massive from dark fruits such as plums, figs and raisins. Sweet malty and some nuts as well. Taste is sweet, dark toffee, raisins and a touch of yeast. Light brandy notes and also a touch of warming alcohol. I had one of these earlier this year, and let me tell you, it gets better with some rest time in the stash.

Matured 1 and a half year on bottle which was probably a little too long. A great fruity aroma lingers in the background and gives a hint of what may have been. The taste is also flawed by the aging, with notes of old paper. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

För att vara en Brown Ale är den helt ok. Tror nog att jag hade lagrat den för länge, 1 år och 3 månader. Kändes platt och smakerna var för svaga. Lite besviken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark amber color boozy head. Big aromas estery bubble gum, caramel, slight perfume ester, slight alcohol. Flavors medium alcohol, caramel, bread, slight bubble gum. Medium sweet. Not to complex but decent. Not a memorable abt.

Big, complex and well crafted. A dense off-white head on a mahogany body. The nose is sumptuous, featuring sweet caramel malt, spice, citrus and tropical fruit, and a fruity tartness. The taste is predictably complex and layered. Dense Caramel and toffee tasting malts, dark fruit, candied fruit, plums, classic spices and a solid element of Belgian yeast (with a slight bubblegum note) add to the blend. Sweet but tart, dense and slick, this is another DDC classic.

Bottle. Pours cloudy ruby-brown with light beige head and lacing. Nose of plums and dried cherries. Cherry skins with some apple and plum notes. Bready malt and caramel follows. Sweetness gives way to a semi-dry note in the finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska. Nougatfärgad med ett medelstort smutsvitt skum. Dofter av marsipan, karamell, läder och frukt. Samma återkommer i smaken tillsammans med en värmande alkohol och lätt av vanilj. Rund och len munkänsla. Mycket bra!

Bottle pour into tulip glass from Learys Fine Wines, Newburyport. Appearance is hazy, light red with discernible small dark chunks of sediment, nice sparkle, 1/2-finger width beige head with poor retention and fair soapy lacing. Aroma is strong dark fruits with notes of caramel and brown sugar and hint of yeast tartness. Taste is rich caramel malts and dark fruits with hint of alcohol. Palate is light-to-medium bodied with smooth, creamy texture, average carbonation and slight alcohol zing to the tongue and warming of the esophagus without noticing as much in the flavor. Overall, a nice, rich representative of the style.

Bottle - pours a murky swap water brown with a thin almost tan head. Sweet and bready aroma filled with ripe fruits, subtle nuttiness and rich malts. A thick mouthful reveals layers of hearty bread, raisin, plum, bran, cooked apple, toasted grain and a hint of pecan.
UPDATED: NOV 16, 2016 341ml Bottle - Dark brown in colour. Brown sugar, grain and dried fruit in the aroma. The taste is fruity, sweet and boozy with raisins, sultanas and brown sugar.
On tap. Brown with creamy beige head. Aroma of caramel, malt, berries, raisin, alcohol. Sweet caramel flavour, wood, warming alcohol

Ameixas secas, Figo, maravilha de breja! Excelente quad! Parabéns aos canadenses!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@ train between Helsingör and Copenhagen 20161001. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty, fruity, sweet, yeasty, dried fruits, raisins, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is sett and alcoholic.

Dark, cloudy brown in color with a tiny head; small specks of sediment floats at the bottom, but its minimal. Aromas of dark fruits ride atop a creamy dessert. Flavors are a blend of chocolates, caramel, dark dried fruits, candied fruits, and rich malts; finishes with more fruity sweetness along with some spice & booze. Reminds me of a crème brulee or holiday fruitcake. Medium-bodied throughout with no carbonation. As it warms, the majority of the initial flavors recede to make way for more spicy & boozy notes. Its an excellent example of the style, but I wish there was more sediment to help the beer as it ages. Cheers! This one comes highly recommended for any Belgian beer fan!

Flaska systembolaget. Disig brunguldig kulör. Doft av äpplemos, jäst och örter. 
Maltig och lätt rostad smak. Järn, torkad frukt och kryddor. Lätt sötma med en ganska sträv och torr munkänsla. Värmande alkohol.
On holiday in Canada dark brown colored body with an off white head and a caramel malt fruity sweet aroma a sweet caramel malt hops alcholic bitter taste with a alcholic bitter finish

Klar, brun och lite röd, khaki färgat litet skum. Doft: Malt, lagrade toner, frukt vin, citron lakrits kola, starkt sött svart te. Smak: Malt, lagrade toner, Cola, trä, lätt bränt socker, citron lakrits kola, konserverad frukt.
Pours reddish brown with a white head. Aroma of dark fruit, dark grains and brown sugar. Taste is heavy sweet, light bitter and light sour.
Pours dark red/brown. Aroma: rich fruit, dates, figs, raisin and yeast. Taste of dried fruit, bread, some bitter spice. Very good but not great.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2017 Apparence : Brune orangée, col brun pâle, belle dentelle laissée derrière, carbonatation lente, beaucoup de levures au fond du verre. 
Nez : Caramel, accents de toffee, fruits confits en arrière-plan, levure belge, effluves dalcool. 
Goût : Levure belge prononcée aux notes épicées sur la langue; caramel, toffee et fruits confits par la suite. La finale présente de très légères notes dalcool avec laspect levuré qui nous suit tout du long ainsi quune faible amertume. Plus elle se réchauffe, plus les fruits confits font leur place. 
Sensation : Bon corps, effervescence qui se mêle avec laspect épicé de la levure, chaleureuse. 
Bref : Cette version (2016) me paraît beaucoup plus axé sur la levure belge que les versions précédentes, ce qui nest pas un défaut en soit considérant le style de la bière! Plus épicée, moins sucrée, alcool moins apparent, on se croirait en compagnie de moines. Et pourtant, il manque un petit quelque chose ou trop de levure justement?
Dark burgundy, almost brown color. Aroma has a lot of sweet fruits, rasins, figs, some alcohol. Taste is sweet with some spices and a lot of yeast. Warm, alcoholic finish. Really good!

11.2 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured reddish brown, cloudy, some sediment, small thin beige head. Aroma of dark fruit, yeast and malts. Taste is sweet, lots of fruit, some bread, yeast and booze. Something special; very good.
UPDATED: JUN 25, 2016 @ Havregatan 25/6-16. Bottle from Systembolaget. Malty, fruity and dried fruity. Body is medium to full, the finish is dried fruity.
Bottle from systembolaget. Pours a amber colour beer with a small head. Apricots dried fruit with some sweetness. Dry finish

Reddish brown colored, moderate head, moderate lace/retention. Aroma is darker sugar, plum, raisin, yeast, light chocolate and caramel. Medium bodied, fairly well structured but as usual the Belgian ones are best..

341ml bottle.
Pours a deep mahogany red/brown, with a beige head.
Spicy, malty, complex aroma, caramel, orange peel, dried fruit, chocolate, phenols, cloves.
Off-dry, medium to full bodied, mid bitterness, smooth CO2.
Spicy, malty taste, caramel, tangerine, figs, chocolate, phenols, licorice.
Well balanced, long finish, alcohol well hidden. Close to awesome. (2016-06-15)

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Flaska från SB, ca 9 månader(?). Disig smutsbrun vätska med fingerhögt beigebrunt skum. Stor maltsötma i doften med russin, torkad frukt, muscovadosocker i mängder, skumbanan. Stor kropp med ganska märkbar alkohol. Söt med mycket torkad frukt, muscovadosocker, choklad, kola. Vägs upp med en del humle i avslutningen. Även en lätt bitter ton från alkoholen. Stor, söt brown ale som tål att smuttas på en stund.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Amber-red colour with a tan head.
Aroma: Fruit, vinous, malt, yeast, alcohol, bread.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Vinous, spices, bread, alcohol, dried fruit, sweet malt.
Bttle. Brun foncé. Col léger. Nez caramel. Idem pour le goût. Finale extra. Bière style trappiste qui na rien à leur envier.

Bouteille de 341ml au Marché des Brasseurs. Brune cola avec une mince mais persistante mousse beige. Nez de caramel et de fruits secs; contrairement à mes confrères, je sent la présence de lalcool à travers ce voile sucré. Elle me semble un peu mince en bouche, mais le goût de caramel, chocolat et fruits légèrement épicés fait vite oublier ce petit point négatif. Lalcool est aussi très bien caché par le goût complexe de ce nectar divin, mais on finit par ressentir un réchauffement au bedon vers la mi bouteille. Super de bonne quad dabbaye... aujourdhui 15 mai il neige à Chénéville, japprécie donc la chaleur de cette bière.
341ml bottle. Dark muddy body with a low head. Chocolate, spices, yeast, soil. Well made.

Bottle picked up at Belmont Portland. pours out a cola brown topped with a tan head. nose is nice complex pit fruit rich malts a nice yeast and a great spice note. Taste is more of the complex sweetness plenty rich malts and a nice spice.

Im growing a deep love for Dieu du Ciel... All the beers Ive had the opportunity to try from them has been so good! 
So this is a happy day! 

The beer pours dark mahogny colored, clear but with a lot of yeast sediment so it looks cloudy. Very creamy, beige, head. More than two finger high at the beginning and slowly fades to a thin beige head with a huge amount of lacing on the glass. 

Nose: Ohhhh... this is so good! Dark fruit (raisin, plum), cherry, red apples, rhubarb, nuts, jam, charcuterie, caramel malt and Belgian yeast. 
Taste: Brown sugar, malt, fudge, toffee, brandy, plum, prune, vanilla and Belgian yeast. 
Mouth: Full body. Light and smooth carbonation. Complex texture. Smooth. Sweet/dry ending. A nice bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2016 Bottle from a trade with sneakychi, many thanks! Hazy brown color with beige head. Aroma is spicy yeasts, fruity plums. Taste is spicy yeasts, chocolate, adstringent bitterness. Quite spicy and earthy-bitter. Medium carbonation. Not exactly what I expect of a quad.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Strong and boozy fruity berries. Not really like the Belgian quads I know. Feasty. Good carbonation. Sweet, but not too extreme. Good, but not as complex as quads can be.
on tap quasi scura schima media fruttato frutta disidratata esteri caramello leggero riscaldante

Dimmig brun öl med beige skum. 
Doft av fikon, torkad frukt, mörkt socker, alkoholsötma och kryddor. 
I smaken tillkommer lite lakrits.

Pours dark brown with caramel notes and a large foamy off white head. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, figs, dates, chocolate, raisins. Taste is boozy sweetness with marinated fruit and hardly any bitterness. Mouthfeel is medium plus bodied with medium carbonation. Good stuff.
Nica big aroma, pours hazy but adequate for this type of beer.. Tate is great... Really good Belgian style strong sold.. Cool
Bottle from systembolaget sweden. Big and lasting light brown head. Clear red brown color. Nice phenolic and caramell aroma. Sweet malty taste with a small caramell tuch and a big body.
Pours a dark body with a thin beige head. Faint aroma of sugary candy. Rich an creamy taste will all sorts of malty flavours and some spicy notes.
Hazy dark amber with off white head that dissipates quickly. Sweet, yet well balanced malt and caramel taste. Excellent quadruple.

341 ml bottle from Systembolaget, web order. Hazy mahogany with a medium size tanned head which makes good lacing on the glass. Rich warm aroma, bread and dried fruit, figs, raisins, prunes, toffee, nutmeg and honey. Full-bodied, chewy mouthfeel. Wow, very pleasant complex taste. Sweetness from vanilla, toffe, raisins, figs and red apples. Spicy notes, cardamom, nutmeg and licorice. Warming notes of brandy and oak in the finish. Very enjoyable.

(341 ml bottle in wine glass.) Pours heavy in dar brown leaving a nice half finger white head. Has a typical sugary aroma with the significant yeast character. Taste has some chocolate followed by a load of heat from the alcohol.

Bien équilibrée et intense, sucré et maltée accent sur le caramel. Légere amertume et de fruit. Malgré le niveau dalcool élevé on ne récent pas une chaleur trop prononcée. Tel que mentionné cette biere dinspiration Belge mais je ny retrouve pas le goût de la levure Belge dont certaines bieres québécoises ont réussirent a obtenir.
Bottle from SB. Dark reddish amber with a thick tan head. Fruity and malty tones. Fruit, malt, caramel and hops. Full body with a nice bitter / fruity finish.

Pours brown with minimal brown head 
Aromas of dried fruits, hints of liqourize, sweet fruits, bread malty 
Taste sweet of caramel, sweet fruits, dried fruits, spices, bready malts

March 31, 2016. Bottle, bottled November 2, 2015. 
Deep ruby red with a small frothy tan head that quickly dissipates into a small ring around the edge. Aroma is sweet brown sugar, baked pear, notes of prunes, dark berries, roasted malt and alcohol. 
Taste is sweet, slight boozy, soft bitter. Finish is sweet toffee, dark bread, light notes of burnt sugar, dried fruits, dark berries and lasting warming alcohol. Medium bodied, very fine, slightly fizzy carbonation. 
Good but a bit hot at the moment, five months since bottling so I guess it would benefit with more time.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2016 0.341ml bottled in November 2014. Pours a clear dark amber with a tan head. Aroma is toffee, caramel, dark fruits, slightly sweet-sour, alcohol notes on the background. Similar to original Belgian versions of this beer style. Taste is sweet, caramel with a slight alcohol bitterness. Surprisingly it is not very rich. Roasted malt, bready aftertaste. Hm... Definitely is not one of the best Dieu du Ciels beer Ive tried...

Bue après un vieillissement dun an. Couleur noir/rubis, avec léger dépôt. Goût incroyable de caramel, de chocolat et dalcool, se comparant avantageusement à un bon porto.

Une bière dans mon top 3!

Murky, copper brown pour with smallish head. Nose is mild funk, brown sugar, earth, dried fruit (lotta figs and raisins), vanilla, some grassy notes. Mouth is medium-full bodied, creamy, decent sweetness up front, chewy, candy sugar, maple, toffee, prunes, toasted pumpernickel, gradually increasing bitterness and finishing with a tanniny mouth. Très Bien.

Bouteille de 341ml.

- Couleur brune rougeâtre avec peu de carbonation.

- Peu d'arômes. Les arômes de levure belge, alcool, fruits secs ressortent le plus.

- En bouche, petit côté boisé, de dattes, notes de caramel, un petite pointe alcoolisé.

- Je suis partial aux bières d'inspiration belges et celle-ci est très fidèle au style. Bien faite, facile à boire pour une bière au-dessus de 10%, les moines seraient fiers de celle-là.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Très bonne, très (trop) légère pour une bière titrant à plus de dix.
Nez magnifique entre la quadruple belge avec un peu de levures, les fruits rouges avec une dominante fraise, pas mal de caramel et fond légèrement épicé.
La bouche est assez sirupeuse mais très douce, pas du tout éthylique, un peu décevante de ce côté. On retrouve une longueur assez caramel épicé avec un léger fond fraise.
Très agréable.

341ml bottle. Opaque, darkest brown colour with late awakening, small, creamy, diminishing, moderately lacing, beige head - a thin beige layer remains throughout. Slightly "boozy" and vinous aroma at distance, close-by notes of dried fruit, plum, raisin, fig, hints of oat flakes on apple purée, blue grapes. Taste is sweet, heavy malty, notes of toffee, some honey, treacle, dried fruit, raisin, fig, blue grapes, plum; full body, oily texture, soft and slightly sticky palate. Cant fully follow those exorbitant ratings, but at least one from Dieu du Ciel! without this apparently appreciated artificial touch.

BOD 1/15, so this has had a year to age. Mahogany brown pour with suspended particulate matter. Outstanding head volume, normal lacing and retention.

Light, but typical Quad nose. Caramel, toffee, subtle charred grain, raisin, light prune, fig and chocolate hints over a sweet background.

Medium body with a semi-slick oily texture. World class carbonation for the style with a burst of effervescence in the middle and a solid prickly finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is intense, very complex and fairly balanced. The alcohol adds a bit of astringency, but the flavor is hidden well. It does makes it presence well known with the burn at the back of the throat. All flavors from the nose make an appearance. The sweeter ones arrive first and by the middle the malt sweetness is at its maximum. From the middle on, the prune and charred characteristics are most prevalent coupled with a slight astringency. Chocolate and toffee appear just before the finish. The finish is a slow warm fade of astringent prune with a subtle sweetness underneath.

Bottle. Pours a dark rich ruby red with a lasting foamy bubbly off white head, lots of lacing around the glass. Aroma is of plums, raisins, blackcurrants, caramel, forest fruits, wood. Taste is of plums, dark fruits, raisins, toffee, figs, warming alcohol notes on the finish. Heavy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Marrom, opaca. Espuma abundante de média duração. Aroma de ameixas com toques florais e de madeira. Sabor adocicado de ameixas secas, com notas de madeira, mel, café e chocolate amargo. Retrogosto amargo com final alcoólico. Complexa e muito saborosa!
Forte, odor leve, amargor moderado, boa cerveja. A melhor das Diel du ciel. Melhor equilibrio alcoolico

Bottle thanks to Paul. Pours a hazy copper with small off white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is belgian yeast and caramel. Medium mouth, very sweet, caramel, light booze, spice, really good.

I feel this one is over rated. Just because monks make it people want to love it. Strong fruitiness and malty. Aroma of caramel. Pours cloudy brown in color with a thin tan head. Had at home out of a bottle.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2016 Aromas of red apple, caramel, brown sugar, raisin skin, alcohol, and bread. Taste is tart plum, raisin, caramel, brown sugar, red apple, yeasty bread, some alcohol and cherry in the finish; warming in the chest.
Bottle. Color red with a small head. Aroma sweet, alcohol, wood. Taste sweet, berries, alcohol, caramel, wood.
12oz bottle at Mackan, thanks! Brown with beige head. Aroma yeasty, roasted, smooth bready malt and some apples. Taste is malty, yeasty, some apples, yeast with warming alcohol. Nice!
Bottle. Pours clear brown with thin off white head. Nose and taste are classic quad. Strong peppery spiciness in the aftertaste. Good.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2015 Robe brune et col beige clair collant un peu au verre.
Nez de fruits frais, fruits mûrs, fruits dans lalcool, fraise, bonbon et fortement épicé.
En bouche, attaque très douce, sucrée et fruitée (fraises, fruits rouge).
Epices, maltage.
Quelque autre chose mais difficilement définissable (quelque chose proche de la levure en paillette et du fromage).

11.5 oz bottle, poured into a snifter at approximately 40 degrees F.

Appearance: Pours a clearish yet dark ruby amber, which forms no head beyond a patchy cap and a ring of white. A few scattered streams of bubbles make their way steadily to the top of the beer.

Smell: Sweet toffee and caramel malt dominates the aroma, carrying a bit of candi sweetness along for the ride. Theres something akin to cranberry drifting through the scent as well.

Taste: Right up front, this is a barrage of caramel, toffee, and candi sugar, and that does not relent through most of the tasting process. The ABV is boldly present as both heat and astringency, providing something of a medicinal taste and a lingering burn on the tongue. Hints of chocolate and something vaguely fruity are present, but buried under the sweetness and alcohol bite. There is a pronounced peppery spice, however, which makes itself known alongside the alcohol.

Mouthfeel: Sharp and hot, this is creamy while in the mouth, and then leaves a sensation not unlike drinking sandpaper.

Overall: Im uncertain if perhaps I got hold of a bad bottle, or if Ive been spoiled by other large ABV beers that conceal their payload, but this would not be a repeater for me. I am generally a fan of sweeter beers, but the heat and medicinal tinge taint the whole flavor profile for me.

There was a very small off white head that didnt linger long or leave much lacing. The aroma is good. I get a little tartness (possible brett) on top. Perhaps some cherry, banana, yeastiness, raisin, caramel and others. Seems like every time you take a whiff you pick up something else. The taste is good. I was afraid that it might be bad from a whiff of brett in the aroma, but it is not the case. A very complex taste. Very full bodied, lots of malts but only a subdued sweetness. Caramel, bready, chocolate, some spices and fruits in the background. Complex and nice. No hint of the alcohol. I would definitely buy it again!

Small bottle. Nose is not much alc, wood, heavy malt, some dark fruit, more malt--and-yeast-derived light fruit. Flavour has a lot of the latter more than dark fruit, spices in the background. A well made light fruit abt with little alcohol flavour by the time it reached my lips. Good stuff, abts often cross over toward "too much", same as Heavy Metal just doesnt seem like hard music just a bunch of posers, but this one struck a balance. Its weird when youre pulling the average down when you actually enjoyed it, but thats the way it goes.
Bottled. Deep brown pour. Figs and dark fruits. Candy sugars. Pretty nice little beer.

This is definitely not a beer for everybody but I like em strong and malty. Prepare from some beautiful, dark aromas of toffee, caramel, rum, and raisins. You will absolutely get a big nostril burn from the booze on this one. The flavor doesnt disappoint. Sugar cane, rum, and booze, booze, booze! One of my first choices for a fireside beer. You cant drink it too fast, it kicks back.
Pours a dark brown, with good head lacing. Aroma of dark fruit, brown sugar, and alcohol. Hints of clove and cinnamon in the taste. Interesting beer!

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch röstmalzig, dunkle reife Früchte, Karamell, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack röstmalzig, fruchtig, überreife Früchte, Karamell, alkoholisch.

Bottle, thnx to Duffman. 2010 vintage. Pours a murky brown beer with a small off white head on top. Aroma has massive vineous notes, grapes and loads of other red fruits going on. Flavor is very sweet, boozy and very vineous again. Loads of Port notes and mellowed out alcohol. Definitely can taste the age on this one. Soft carbonation going, medium short, sweet aftertaste. Could be a bit thicker but overall a very nice quad.

341ml bottle from Saveur-Biere
Bottled 03/2013 - Pours dark brown with a smooth white head. Aroma of ripe fruits, plums, sweet syrupy malts, chocolate and berries. Taste is smooth, sweet and malty with notes of berries, ripe fruits, plums, syrup and chocolate. Finish is sweet, sticky and warming with malty notes, ripe fruitness, yeast and spices. Quite heavy and complex, sweet and malty abt.

341ml bottle. Hazy copper with a foamy beige head. Flavors are molasses, caramel, chocolate, dough, cherry, raisins, plums, dates, banana, spices and alcohol. Full body, moderate carbonation, velvety texture.
Belle couleur brique avec un léger collet. Liquide limpide. Nez anisé. En bouche la réglisse et le caramel s'affronte.

Brown pour with off white head. Big aroma of prunes, toffee, coffee cake, red fruit. Flavour has all the same notes. Light bitterness to cut the sweetness. Alcohol provides some warmth and lingers with sweet notes. Quite good.

Aroma is dark fruits , clove and abbey yeast. Some Belgian sugar notes aswell. Taste is quite fruit with some sweet malt character and slight liquor taste on tip. Clear amber body has a pearl head that retains well.
Cherry, oak. Roasted malt, rich dark cherry, grape, plum, cocoa beans, nut, sour finish. Awesome elegance, great balance, getting close to wine texture and complexity.
Dark ruddy pour, small brown head. Fruity cherry aroma. Toasty flavor, alcohol notes.

Pours a mostly clear chestnut with garnet highlights, a small almost tan head and little lacing. Aroma is sweet and fruity with cherry candy, red apple peel, some brown sugar and a hint of booze. Taste is initially quite sweet and follows nose with the cherry and apple peel fruitiness, along with some molasses. Becomes drier midway through with a malt component that straddles toasty and roasty. Has earthy and spicy flavors in the aftertaste along with a bit if alcohol that also provides some warming. Finishes semi dry with a light lingering spiciness. Body is light with moderate carbonation. Drinkable despite the higher ABV. The sweet malt flavors balance with the fruit and spices from the yeast making this unique and enjoyable. Would try again but would be best with food. Maybe a cherry tart.

Sweet apricot and date aromas, lovely dark auburn color, low head. Caremelly heavy malt body with tastes of syrup. Brandy-like at times, wine-like at others. Low hop bittering. Thick body with a warming alcohol effect after the swallow.

Bottle, vintage 2013, copper brown pour, nice thick creamy head. Sweet aroma of raisins, spices, and malty sweetness. Taste, mild sweetness, butterscotch, Belgian spices and yeast, very little hint of the ABV. Nice example of the style, still a bit young but overall really nice, another solid offering from DDC.
Bottle. Dark copper brown. Slightly Belgian but nothing as strong as the other quads. Dark fruits but malts to balance it out. Bit boozy for 10%.
Poured from the tap. Murky copper brown with very minimal dissipating offwhite head. Fruit and fudge and alcohol. Mild caramel, mild bitterness. Medium body.

pours a hazy copper brown with a thick light tan head. Good lacing and retention. Aroma is sweet and spicy. Brown sugar, raisins, cloves, and some toasty malt. Taste is quite sweet. Flavors include toffee, caramel, some darker fruits and some sort of exotic spice and brown sugar. Good mouthfeel, rich, smooth, and warming. Pretty dang good, but a little too sweet for me.

Hazy brown in color... Aroma of caramel, molasses, brown sugar, Belgian candi sugar.... Flavor is nuts, hints of anise licorice, caramel, Belgian yeast on palate... Solid

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a semi transparent (looks thick) light brown with a small spotty off white head. Aroma is rich maltiness, dark dried fruits, caramel, and some chocolate notes. Flavour is rich maltiness, dark dried fruits, faint alcohol, caramel, chocolate and spicy Belgian yeast phenols. Tasty well balanced and kinda easy drinking... Watch out!

Pours a clear dark amber with with a tan head that forms into a ring. Aroma of caramel, brown sugar, plums, raisins, dates and a light smooth alcohol. Flavor is complex dark dried fruits, caramel, brown sugar sweet maltiness and a nice smooth alcohol warming on the finish. Exceptionally smooth and well balanced quad, complex and rich and dangerously easy to drink.
Arom of malts and fruit. Taste of alcohol heat, raisins, roasted malts, yeast, bread, etc. Not bad but would find it difficult to consume more than one a sitting.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 On tap at St Augustines in Vancouver. A dark brown ale, with a bit of head. Fruity on the nose. Malty, fruity on the tongue. No hop detected nor expected. A decent quad, but not of the caliber of Bernardus, methinks. 
And Sep 23, 2014 at Alibi Room in Vancouver. Still a great quad!

Une mousse légère par-dessus une rousse couleur. Des teintes de dattes, de raisins, de chocolat, de whisky, ... Contrairement à dautres, je ne goûte pas tant lalcool qui, pourtant, devrait être là quelque part (10,5%!!!)... Une bière riche, complexe et transcendante.

341 ml bottle. Pours a dark brown with light head of big bubbles. Aromas of raisins, spice, chocolate, and metal. Flavors of raisins/figs, nutmeg, chicory, light chocolate, and malt extract. Good but expecting better.
Pours dark hazy Amber with a frothy ivory head. Nose of sweets, dates, Carmel. First taste is quite sweet, rolls into caramel, fruit, honey. The tastes smooth out as it warms up.

Short pour @ When Pigs Fly. Clear reddish amber in color, small head. From the first whiff the Trappist yeast hits the nostrils big time. With caramel and dates. Flavor profile is bold. The dates, rich caramel and traces of candy sugar upfront with a syrupy molasses texture through the middle. The Belgian yeast is displayed really well in the finish. No telling how old the keg is but the ABV is well hidden. The body is lean but not negative at all. Dangerously easy to drink. Excellent.

Rated on 3-11-2010 (Bottle) This beer pours a medium sized very fizzy ivory head that mostly diminishes, mostly transparent/slightly hazy reddish brown body, fizzy carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is caramel malt, yeast, bitter, sweet, dark fruits, spicy, and some alcohol. The taste is sweet, caramel malt dark fruits, spicy, and alcohol. The palate is tingly and this beer is light-medium bodied. In conclusion, this beer has a warming sensation, worth trying and a beer I would definitely drink again. This is my kind of beer! More please!

Un col de mousse plutôt mince mais persistant. Odeur de fruits confits de caramel. Très maltée et sucrée, selon moi, elle est trop fort en Alcool. Les fruits sont assombris. Bonne acidité. Une pointe épicée forte apparaît en finale.

Belle couleur brune foncée avec une touche de prune. Une légère mousse plutôt dense crème brulée amène de bonnes arômes. Celles qui ressortent le plus sont le caramel, lalcool semblant au whisky et le chocolat brulé. Au goût, le sucre est présent en bouche du début à la fin mélangé avec des saveurs dalcool qui englobent le tout. Les saveurs sont difficiles à percevoir puisque ce ne sont que le sucre et lalcool qui dominent. Un sucre semblable à du caramel. Cest une bière qui réchauffe la gorge et qui se déguste tranquillement.

Bottle shared at t Klooster, Delft. Pours cloudy copper with a small beige head. Aroma is caramel, toffee, alcohol, band-aid, medicinal, red fruits and raisin. Heavy sweet and light bitter. Not as complex as other abts. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

A muddy light brown, little bit of white head. Smells earthy, tea, caramel, a slight bit of sour. Taste is very earthy, peppery, sweet tea, caramel, cigarette ash, a little bit of hop bitter towards the end. The earthiness is a little overwhelming but overall an interesting taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle, pours redish brown, minimal head. nose of pitted fruits, toast. taste is sweet, some muddled fruit. sweetness is borderline cloying and lingers.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2014 Chaque gorgé est une expérience incroyable jusquà la dernière goûte. La complexité entre le coté épicé, lalcool subtile, la texture parfaite et plein dautre chose que je ne veux pas comprendre :)

Août 2104: Ouverte au chalet après 10 mois de vieillissement.
Je suis satisfait par la complexité et la force des arômes même avant ma premiere gorgé. 
Il y a des impressions pruneau, canneberge, cendre.
En bouche, jadore lattaque épicé et pétillante, et le tout est enveloppé un goût puissant de caramel.
La finale est longue à souhait et chaleureuse.
Je recommence le cycle en dégustant chaque seconde.

Best belgian speciality ale beer in the world.
Ill really love taste oak version

12oz bottle pours near-opaque dark brown with red tint and a finger of head. Nose is malty dark fruit, plum, bread, a hint of booze. Taste is sweet dark fruit, pear, molasses, plum, dark bread. Finish is sweet bready fig and plum. Good.

At cellar temperature and into a shallow snifter. Vigorous pour lifts a frothy, off white head that settles back to a half inch of tight foam that laces a messy weave. Good clarity even with the thin yeast pack going in. Ruddy, chestnut brown with no evident carbonation. There is a rusty nails and damp wood edge to the nose. Dark, stonefruit, caramel, freshbaked bread, tart berries, sticky milk chocolate and marzipan, Madeira wine and a touch of sherry fill it out making for a nice, complex aroma. Oooh, wow; thick and boozy on the palate - very satisfying. Oily, assertively heated finish warms the very depths. Lots of bitter, dark fruit, weedy and woody with licks of yeast, toffee and caramel, roasted carob and vanillin. Vinous with a long, bitter/sweet aftertaste. Something mildly chemical in there but it is forgivable. A slow sipper suited for the Winter months and not the middle of a W.A. Summer. Goes down with a smile and plenty of contemplation. Very nice! (34,1cL, Bottled 03/13, Thirsty Camel, The Quarie, Hammond Park)
A profité vite avant qu?elle ne soit plus disponible, si vous le pouvez et surtout êtes capables conserver s?en quelques une pour 6 mois et plus à goûter absolument

Visuellement, la Rigor Mortis présente une robe brune parsemée de reflets rougeâtres. Un col de mousse plutôt mince mais persistant surplombe une bière légèrement voilée. Un bouquet riche de fruits confits (prunes), de caramel et dalcool nous fait saliver dès les premières respirations. Bien maltée et sucrée, la forte teneur en alcool réchauffe agréablement bien le palais. Les fruits rouges en bouche apportent une acidité discrète, mais surprenante. Une pointe épicée apparaît en finale pour ajouter à la complexité de ce grand classique de Dieu du Ciel. Délicieuse!

Ambrée foncer avec un col moyen marron/beige foncé. Larôme est un peu sourdine: levure, fruits et malt. Le goût est très bon. Dabord, le il est du malt sucré, puis du levure fruité, ensuite la finale est sec, légèrement amer et terreux. Ces trois stages sont distinctives. Cest une bière complexe avec un palais épais et un carbonisation moyenne/faible.
Pours a very dark brown with a brown head. Aroma is malt, fruit, citrus, caramel, roasty with some alcohol. Taste is medium sweet leading to a sweet and lightly alcoholic finish. Damn good!

Bottle. Pours a murky reddish brown with thin, dense, diminishing tan head and nice soapy lace. Nose of cherry, prune, caramel, brown sugar, slight cardboard. Medium to full body. Sweet with a lot of fruit flavors, mostly cherry. Some bitterness and slightly warming

Very sweet! Love ddc, had always wanted to try this one. Im so used to ddc envelope - pushing and unique brews, was expecting this to have a lot of personality, but quite a tame, fruity, caramelly, smooth yeasty quad. A nice treat for a warm winter night, but lacks something edgy and special that each ddc brew seems to have.

Muddy brown pour with small beige head that dissipates to a fine layer. Aroma is of dark malts and caramel and sweet red fruits. Hops and yeast in the background. Sweet caramalised sugars and chocolate malts for taste with some acidity in the aftertaste. Alcohol is warming but still hidden. Medium bodied with average carbo. Nice quad indeed! From trade with Alehunter. Thanks Dominic.

Bottle from Total Wine in Boca Raton, FL. 12oz bottle poured into a snifter. Deep brown pour with an eggshell, thick head. Aroma of dark fruits, dark candy sugars, caramel and Belgian yeasts. The taste is dark fruits like prunes, raisins, and plums. Dark sugars for sweetness and the caramel notes come out as it warms. Medium to heavy body with Belgian yeasts and carbonation. Finishes with spices.

Bottled sample via BreWedge. Tawny brown in colour with moderate carbonation. Aromas are of pale malt, sweet orange, dates and caramel. Flavours are of pale, toasted, and dark caramel malts, dried berries, with a touch of iron on the finish. Light bodied for the style in a good (drinkable) way. Not boozy at all. Not as complex as some of the world class Belgian interpretations of the style, but makes up for it in terms of sheer drinkability.
11.5 oz bottle from Tipsys. Brown with a small head. Dark fruit, yeast, caramel, chocolate, alcohol and light spices. Malty, sweet and strong with light bitterness. Full body.

Bottle at home from an IP trade, 13/12/13.
Murky mahogony brown with a moderate light tan covering that clears to a swirl and edgework,
Nose is cake mix, brown sugar, light booze, bitter dark fruit waftings, dark bery fruit, stewed prunes and dates.
Taste comprises rich dark fruit mash, caramelised raisens, toffee fudge, dates, stewed prunes, fruit loaf, light booze cloak.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet dark fruit notes in the closure.
Nice Quad, well balanced, good drinkability, not too hot at any point.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Je déguste en ce moment-même une bouteille tirée dune caisse vieillie dun an. Au service: belle mousse abondante dun blanc coquille doeuf disparaîssant subitement. Quà celà ne tienne; la voie est maintnant ouverte permettant aux riches arômes de caramel, gâteau aux fruits, dattes (Cointreau?) de prendre leur envol librement. Nous ne désirerions résister à y plonger puisque le liquide, de par sa robe trouble mi brune-mi orangée nous convie dun ton autoritaire à la dégustation.
Aucune surprise en bouche: la texture est soyeuse, leffervescence délicate et lamertume quasi-absente (est-ce le fait du vieillissement?). Lalcool a beau être présent, on ne le remarque que très peu grâce à la rondeur dun complexe bouquet (où sentremêlent caramel, dattes, raisins secs, et mangue Atulfo) qui sestompe tout de même rapidement. 
Somme toute une magnifique bière dhiver procurant un grand réconfort. Merci à Dieu Du Cieil pour un autre magnifique produit!
Light aroma of malt, caramel and toffee. Nice taste of bread and caramel, has a nice balance of malt sweetness with a good palate.

Aromas ligeros. Sabor suave, notas a chocolate, ligera madera se percibe en boca. Final medio. 
En resumen una excelente cerveza de gran calidad!
Aroma of dark fruits. odd cloudy amber brown pour. Taste is sweet - dark fruits toffee and maybe brown sugar, but NOT overdone. good brew

brassée comme une bière noire dabbaye. Assez proche de la Rochefort 10 par exemple. Couleur ambre foncé, nez sur les fruits noirs, la prune cuite, un peu de café. Bouche très sucrée sur le caramel torréfié, le café, un peu dépices. Finale assez longue, mais un peu lourde et trop sucré, devient vite écoeurante.

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2016 Excellent! Riche et douce à la fois... À chaque fois que jy reviens, je suis toujours charmé par sa belle couleur et sa chaleur enveloppante en bouche. Elle a un petit côté vineux et est bien effervescente. Jaimerais bien en avoir en format 750 ml pour boire dans quelques années ;-)

Bottled March 2013. Aroma of forest berries. Nearly no head at all. Taste is burnt caramel, roasted malts, hints of dried fruits, some cardboard & a little Vegemite. Doesn't hide the ABV nearly as well as the Straffe Hendrick quad I just had. Think this one would definitely benefit from further aging.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours nearly-clear dark ruby, with thin tan lacing. Slightly sour aroma with brown sugar and light spice. Taste has spice, caramel and brown sugar, dry booze, and candy sugar with a dry finish. Overall quite good.

Vieilli 7 mois. Couleur Brune-rouge avec des particules avec un col qui disparait vite, Nez de malt et de petit fruit me faisant penser un legerement a du vin rouge. En bouche les saveurs dominantes sont le malt et les fruits qui apporte une certaine amertume mais rien dextreme. Une bien qui est bien assemblé mais nest pas dans mes gouts.

Bottle from Lille (thanks to Loz) purchased April 2013 consumed at home Sunday 27th October 2013   Pours murky, muddy brown not much if any head (at the moment). On the nose I get demerara sugar, sweet balsamic and spices aplenty, nice aroma. Big, full on beer, soft but sweetish. Tangy with some dried fruits a little prune for instance, but spicey in mouth as well. A jolly decent beer.  A7 A3 T8 P5 Ov15 3.7

Aged 6 months
Rich aroma. Sweet malt, dark bittersweet chocolate. a little roasty. caramel, dark fruit. 
A very good, sweet, malt, roast balance. Very rich.

Pours a deep ruby reddish brown. Medium creamy off-white head, fully lasting. Aroma is deep and complex and stands out the most in this beer.; rich dark malt, caramel, dark fruit, brown sugar- "aged sweetness", some alcohol. Flavor follows.Medium to full body. Very complex flavor and palate. Balance malty sweetness, spice, some alcohol. Finish is semi-sweet, woody, and fairly dry, Soft and creamy. Aged 6 months.

341mL bottle. Cloudy brown, tan cap. Aroma of spices, dark fruit (plums, prunes, purple raisin), and some molasses. Taste is incredibly balanced for a 10.5%. More dark fruits, but raisin shines. Some hints of white chocolate, and fig. First had this in 2009 or early 2010, and loved it.

Bottle. Pours a deep thick brown color. Nose is sweet and fruity . Taste is sweet and malty with fruity notes. Additionally nice spices complement the fruit. Finish is sweet and malty, alcohol well masked. Quaff Score 8 / 10
Pours a muddy amber with a beige head and sweet, fruity wine aroma. Taste is sweet and fruity, wine notes, with fruits, berries, caramel, and bread notes leading to a warming, spicy finish. Nice brew

Bottle drank after some awesome tuna tartare I made while Jenny and I watch reruns of Psych. Aroma starts out with hints of butterscotch but doesnt get quite as sugary as initial impressions would suggest. More burnt caramel, apple/plum skins, and black pepper in the nose that blunt the residual sugars. Tastes of clean, sweet caramel chews with plenty of black pepper spiciness. Malty body with a nice earthy, prickly spice. Body is slightly velvety, moderate thickness. Really well balanced and clean!

A half year old bottle. A dark brown beer with a medium and beige head. The nose of dark and ripe fuits with medium sweetness, spices, some alcohol and anise, also hint of earthyness in the background. Taste of dark and dried fruits with some sweetness, prunes, bananas, spices, also some alcohol in the middle, the end is still slightly booze and dries only a little. Medium+ bodied, balanced carbonation. Quite sweet and dark fruity beer with hint of booze, that is not bothering, but not very sophisticated.
Aroma is heavy caramel, malts and medium sweetness. The flavor is malts, caramel, light bananas, sweet toffee, fruit and a mix of alcohol and tangy/tart in the finish.

Super complex with hints of fig, raisins and chocolate/ espresso. Its definite you can taste the roasted malt throughout, a tasty treat with a nice non-hop bitter finish. Its an amazing addition to my ratebeer ratings. Thank you Christian!
From a 12 oz bottle shared with Ryan. Pours a cloudy dark brown with a thick ecru head. Aroma of caramel. Flavors of caramel, raisin and candi sugar. Smooth, moderately carbonated, mouthfeel.
Superbes arôme entre la douceur de l alcool du caramel et des fruits rouges et une légère amertume très bien calculée.

Dark caramel brown with scant, beige head, light lacing (barrel-aged?) / Sweet, rich nose of caramel, dark fruit, cream, spice / Medium to full body, malty and chewy, excellent balance and lightly bitter finish / Flavors of fresh caramel, chocolate, fig, date, allspice / Could be a little fuller bodied, with bigger fruit, but I nickpit.
Odeur caramel et épice, belle robe rouge brun opaque, goût un bel équilibre sucre et amertume, chaude et ronde en bouche, long arrière goût terreux. Bonne bière de dégustation.

on draft. poured a dark brown with big fluffy head. the aroma was malt and light bread, sweet somewhat fruity but very subtle. hints of chocolate. the flavor just melts in your mouth. very smooth roasted malts and some chocolates. I also got touches of some dark fruit added to the flavor. I have had this before but first time on draft. remarkable beer.
Brune en bouteille 341ml peu damertume sans arrière goût. Goût sucré de caramel très bonne bière

341ml bottle from restaurant. Really enjoyed this one. Nothing too noticeable with the aroma but the flavour was full of fruits and spices that always welcomed another sip and never overpowered. Very strong beer, but not immediately obvious by the taste, so watch out. One for the end of the night.

Extremely nice. Brown with red and orange tint. Thick creamy off white head. Aroma is malty sweet. Taste is raisin and plum. Sweet fruity sticky caramel. Nice beer. Did not go with fries and beer chese. Would probably go well with a fruit pie.

Hazy brown pour with a white head. The aroma is full of raisins, toffee, grapes and cherries. The flavor is similar with a lot of dark fruit character mixed with some toffee, brown sugar and alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a dark rubyish auburn with a decent, beige head. Aroma is quite alcoholic. Caramel and dark syrup, light apricot and peach. Some salty liquorice and grain. Taste is quite alcoholic as well. Sweet with caramel and syrup. Some salty liquorice, quite a bit of ethanol. Dark fruits somewhat. Finishes with a lot of salty liquorice and ethanol. Brings to mind Finnish salty liquorice liquor. Fairly full, decently carbonated. Too boozy.

Bouteille de 341 ml. 2,99$ à la Saucisserie BDF. Arôme de fruits très très mûres (prunes, raisins), de cassonade et dalcool. Bière dune belle couleur rouge ambrée avec une belle opacité. Le col beige est très mince et disparaît rapidement. En bouche la bière est très onctueuse et le goût sucrée est très prononcé, peu houblonnée avec très peu damertume. Le goût de cassonade reste présent sur les lèvres et en arrière goût. Jai malheureusement bu la bière après seulement 4 mois dembouteillage... sacrilège. Jen rachète une bouteille le plus tôt possible et cette fois je la laisse vieillir!  Malgré tout cest une très très bonne bière.  Pour buveur averti seulement :)

Pours deep amber/ruby with a medium off white head...nice lacing. Aroma has dark fruits...fig, raisin, prune. Flavor has light roastiness and sweet malts...brown sugar...plenty of dark fruits...earthy/leathery bitterness. mouthfeel is full and silky with an earthy/fruity/leathery and slightly bitter finish.

2013/07/07 - Pours an opaque brown amber colour with a small tan head that reduces quickly. Aroma is dark fruits (grapes and plumbs), toasted malts, yeast, spices and slight booze. Taste is dark fruits, caramel, spices and molasses with a slightly boozy, cloyingly sweet finish. Mouthfeel is medium and oily with smooth carbonation. Found this to be almost too sweet, but I may have opened it too early. Will compare to an older bottle at some point. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 Bière brune aux reflets rouge, totalement voilée avec quelques particules en suspension, bonne effervescence, col brunâtre plutôt mince mais résistant. Arômes principalement maltés, pain grillé, toutes sortes dodeurs sucrés (caramel, cassonade, mélasse, sucre brut), petits fruits foncés très mûres (prunes, cerises, raisins, mûres), avec certains effluves rappelant davantage le grain rôti, la torréfaction, le chocolat, voire même le malt fumé avec certaines notes de bacon, viande fumée, poisson fumé même. Lalcool est également présent au nez, ainsi que certaines traces plus herbacées. Le nez est agréable, très complexe, il manque peut-être un peu dintensité cependant. En bouche, ce nest pas très pétillant, légèrement mousseux, mais lonctuosité au palais est très intéressante, cest rond et soyeux. Au goût, comme le nez laissait présager, cest bien malté, pain grillé, abondantes saveurs sucrées, petits fruits foncés très mûres. Mais ce nest pas nécessairement très sucré en bouche, principalement parce quon y retrouve beaucoup dalcool, peut-être un peu trop, quoique ça reste très bien intégré tout de même. On retrouve également un léger houblon herbacé qui prend surtout place en fin de bouche apportant alors une finale à lamertume légère mais bien sentie qui donne à cette bière un équilibre très bien réussi. ///// Le vieillissement est véritablement bénéfique à cette bière! Dailleurs, le brasseur lui-même suggère sur létiquette un vieillissement dau moins 6 mois. Je peux dire quaprès 14 mois de vieillissement, le breuvage devient merveilleusement corpulent, merveilleusement rond en bouche, les petits fruits foncés très mûrs deviennent explosifs au goût, la torréfaction, le chocolat noir, se rajoute aux saveurs sucrées, et lalcool devient moins goûteux, tout en nous envahissant toujours les joues de sa réconfortante chaleur. Lintégration des saveurs entre elles devient presque parfaite, et la bière ne perd rien de son équilibre très bien réussi. De très bonne fraîche, cette bière devient véritablement excellente lorsque vieillie environ un an. Disponible seulement à lhiver, faites vous des réserves pour lhiver prochain!

Pours a murky, opaque, chestnut with very little head.Smells of spice and alcohol, with hints of vanilla and molasses. Taste is very different from the nose. Ripe fruits, alcohol, notes of spice and raisins. Has a sweetness to it. Medium to high carbonation. Medium body with a smooth texture. A very different quad than I have had before. Worth having a few bottles.

Deep dark brown with touch of red, small tan head. Aroma caramel, yeast, malt. Full body. Quite minimal alcohol. Faintly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor pretty sweet, molasses-filled baking bread. Some dried fruits, spice. A tad sweeter than I would prefer but nonetheless rich and complex and enjoyable.
Nice flavorful ABT. The beer had a nice dark caramel color. The flavor is dry with a little bit of spice. Good aroma as well. Overall, I recommend.

Bottle 341 ml. Pours light brown in color with a tan head. Sweet malty, raisins, dough and nutty notes in 
aroma. A bit of boozy notes in taste. Sweet malts, toffee and earthy nuttyness in taste. Quite soft. 
Cloying sweet finish.
12oz bottle at Monk's Kettle. Pours a coppery brown color with a bit of frothy head. Lots of subtle flavors all coming together here. Needs a few minutes to breathe.

Reddish brown pour with a quickly-dissipating head. The smell is dried fruits, wood, and wine. Flavor is sweet, no bitterness. It is a bit tangy, lots of caramel as well as dark fruits. Not as vinous as the smell would suggest but it is there. The yeast note is a subdued. Not bad but not on par with the best in this hard to pull off style.

Slightly hazy dark brown pour with a nice light tan head. Nose is malty goodness with hints of dark fruit and spice. This beer has a very nice mouthfeel - almost no indication that its 10.5% until a little alcohol in the finish. Quite nice!

Taken in La Trappe San Fransisco on 6 Feb 2013. The basement is very dark (where we sat anyway), so I had trouble seeing the true colour of the beer: it looked dark brown though. The bottle label being dark also was almost unseeable too, which is a shame because the art work is lovely.

The smell told me however I had a great beer in front of me, even if I couldnt see it too well. Malty molasses and rich fruit esters filled my nose and I couldnt wait to taste it.

The richness of the flavours exploded in my mouth, sweet malty molasses (like the aroma) with hints of toffee, caramel and chocolate. Add dark fruit and yeastiness into the mix and you have a very tasty beer indeed.

Full bodied and rich from the first sip, overall an excellent beer.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2015 First draft at Eulogy in May 2013 then again at Eulogy in September 2015. Hazy dark brown pour. Off-white lace. Dark caramel bready flavors. Browned dark red stone fruit. Plums and prunes. Blackberries. Currants. Dry spicy peaty vegemite notes. Aged celery hearts. Dried figs. Dates. Lots of ancient dead fruit. Sweet molasses at the start but has a solid dry black pepper finish. Complex peaty raisin notes. Little aroma when cold but warms into a spicy sweet Sherry cordial.

Dark brown poor with a pleasant frothy white head. Aroma of ripe dark fruits slight spice. Flavour is the same but more so.  Boozy with a pleasant after burn.  Has a slight molasses after taste. As it warms up there is a faint flavour of chocolate.  The beverage also becomes really nicely mellow.

Poured on tap at Eulogy in philly. Full finger of creamy head retreated quickly to leave minimal lacing. Color is a nice medium browb. Nose is insanely strong. Dark and milk chocolates dominate. Taste was somewhat disappointing. Slight soapiness, very little of the chocolate from the nose. Still pleasantly sweet and well balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Clear amber pour, thin off white head ... aroma of rich molasses, caramel malts, candi sugar and chocolate malts .... taste is of sugary caramel malts, chocolate malts, spicy dark fruity yeast, molasses with a bitter bite ... finish is dry, bitter and malty .... a bit boozy in the taste for me and sweeter than id like an abt, but this is def a solid above average abt just lacks the mouthfeel

Bottle.  Pours a murky dark mahogany color with a small foamy head that fades but never completely goes away.  Aroma is cherries and chocolate with hints of caramel and spices.  Tastes bit like chocolate covered cherries but without being rich at all.  More of a boozy taste and the carbonation is a little foamy.  Kinda cough syrupy.  Finish is very boozy, especially when it warms up.  Overall, a very nice aroma with a disappointing taste.  Not really my thing here.

Location/Date:Bottle shared with Dave on 5/16/2013.
Appearance: Pours a dark brown. 
Aroma: Aroma is slightly earthy, hints of caramel.
Taste: Draft fruit, some chocolate and caramel, earthy on the end.
Palate:Medium body, slick.
Summary: Definitely one of the better beers of this style Ive had made on this continent. Probably the second best Dieu du Ciel beer Ive had. Impressive.

Wonderful beer from DDC, bottle at Milos. Wonderfully complex in both aroma and taste--dark, darker than a typical Abt but with all the great characteristics of the best Quads. Not quite on the level of a Rochefort 10 or a Westvleteren 12, but not all that far behind, in my books.

Bottle @ The Kernel. Cheers to Scopey for bringing this along. The pours deep brown with a small tan head. The aromas plum, dark forest fruits. Some chocolate. Toffee. Boozy raisin cake. The taste is more of the same. Syrupy sweetness. Plenty of dark fruits. Light candi sugar. Bubble gum. Robust hot finish. Full body, oily. Overall, a decent cold weather beer!

341ml bottle. Hazy ruby-brown body, small cappuccino head with good retention. Aroma of yeast, lemon, raisins, herbal hops, sour cherry and lightly grains. Taste of yeast, brown sugar, cinnamon, raisins and a mix of dried dark berries, a touch of hop bitterness, plenty of alcohol. Lots of sedimentation. A tad oily.

Poured a cloudy bright orange. 2 finger white head. Smell is loaded with caramel, candied sugar, dark fruits and a hint of citrus. Wow. sweet, spicy and warming. ABV is nicely hidden, great citrus taste, lovely yeasty finish.

Cuivrée foncée avec des reflets rubis et un col de mousse abondant sans persistance. Nez de caramel chaud et de levures belges. Plus amère que dans mes souvenirs avec un arrière goût de sucre cuit. Profil très «scotch ale». Je persiste à croire que cette bière est née pour vieillir un peu...

2-year old bottle shared at The Kernel. It pours deep cloudy brown with a bubbly beige head. The nose is earth, dark fruit, raisin, candy sugar, caramel, toffee, chocolate and spice. The taste is toast, earth, spice, dark fruit, alcohol warmth, candy sugar, wood, cherry and umami aspect with a dry, lightly spiced finish. Full body, moderate carbonation and oily mouth-feel. Good depth of flavour. Nice take on the quad.
Bottle.  Prune and chocolate/caramel malt aroma.  Cloudy brown with small head.   Very sweet raisin, brown sugar/caramel malt and moderately bitter herbal hops flavor.  Nice.

Pours murky, wood-brown with a slight, off-white head.
Scent is chocolate, plums, yeast.
Taste is sweet chocolate, fruit, caramel, sugar.
A slight bit of alcohol bitter.
Very smooth...woody.
Very good.

Le liquide est brun-cuivré opaque,le col est comme de la houle avec son anneau de dentelle.Au nez, les levures belges sont très présentes et ses sucres résiduels aussi.Au goût,le liquide est huileux avec une douceur bien mise et une saveur boisé et caramélisé.En final,une chaleur alcoolisé que lon sent bien descendre.Une abt des plus réussi !

12oz Bottle, poured cloudy brown with barely a head and not much lacing worth noting. Aromas are in your face brown sugar, plum, bourbon and cherry malt. Taste was much of the same with lots of dark fruit and robust roast working together. Light carbonation with a medium to fuller body. Dieu du Ciel doesnt make many bad beers. 3.8

Perhaps Im not the right person to rate a quadrupel. This is the first one and maybe my last. I do love the aromas of fruits, grapes, sour notes from an old shed in late winter, and some ripe berries, very pungent, almost as in tutti-frutti bubblegum. The appearance is more humble, a cloudy dark walnut with a thin, meagre head. But the taste does not hold it. Too fragile to hold the high alcohol content. In the end, for me it does not taste like a beer, but as something strong that has been poured into a good beer. It wont dissuade me to try other products from this very reputable Canadian brewery.

Dunkel malziger Antrunk, der an belgische Trappisternbiere erinnert. Vergoren fruchtige Noten, intensiv, zu keiner Zeit ist der Alkohol erkennbar. Rundes, sehr gelungenes Starkbier, das schmeckt als wäre es lange gelagert. 9/11/11/13/11/12

Dégustée en fût sur place. De couleur brune et légèrement voilée. Nez fruité (raisins légèrement vineux, prunes sucrées, notes de cerises et de figues), malté de caramel toffee, léger de chocolat noir des notes de sucre brun et de houblon herbeux. Moyenne-ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture légèrement liquoreuse aux notes crémeuses. Goût fruité (raisins très faiblement vineux, léger de prunes avec des notes de cerises noires, de pruneaux et de poires) avec des faibles notes épicées (poivre) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de caramel toffee aux notes rôties avec des notes de sucre brun et de chocolat noir puis en finale lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool doux réchauffant avec une très légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen-long, légèrement amer de rôti et dalcool doux avec un goût fruité (moût de prunes et de raisins). (printemps 2006)

341 ml bottle @ OHaras Freehouse, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100305.
Pours murky brown color with a medium sized head. Aroma of ripe fruits, some hop notes, caramel malts, yeast and spices. Flavor of caramel malts, spices, ripe fruits and some sugar. Quite complex, yet well balanced brew. Excellent.

Bottle at craft ale house. Pours hazy brown without head, light carbonation. The aroma Is loaded with brown sugar, fig, plum, and a bit of booze. The taste has a nice sweetness that develops into a raison and fig flavor. The alcohol is well hidden. The palate is sticky and delightful.

341mL thanks to GT2. Muddy dark brown pour. Thicker beige foam. Older bottle, probably 5-6 years old. Maple syrup, honey, bourbon, cinnamon nose. Taste is maple honey bourbon. A bit boozy, vanilla. Man this is good. Tastes like a Toblerone minus the chocolate, just the praline and almond aftertaste. Great mouthfeel, not too sticky like I was expecting. I could get drunk on this! Drunk out of a Westvleteren chalice FTW.

Bouteille 341 ml de lEmpire du Malt - Clermont-Ferrand (F). Linceul brun-roux, mousse ocre pâle mortuaire. Parfum malté fruité, alcool, caramel-mélasse, esters puissants. Le goûr est intense de malt costaud, mélasse, chocolat, pruneaux secs, fruits mûrs, riche et rond. Bière crémeuse, très sucrée, peu amère mais bonne à réveiller un ..

Très légèrement translucide, semble plutôt mince à lil. Col de mousse anémique. Relativement discrète à lodeur, elle évoque néanmoins le rude hiver québécois et la neige poudreuse. On note aussi du chocolat et de la gomme balloune. Très légèrement aqueuse, épicée et boisée, presque piquante. Un peu de chêne, encore plus de sucre cuit ; on perçoit même des agrumes en tout début de gorgée. Surprenante sur le contrôle de lalcool, et effervescence tout en douceur. Un petit peu de métal. Elle est étonnamment accessible pour une bière si costaude. Saveurs bien équilibrées, le bois domine, le tout est assez enchanteur. Une petite mort que lon veut répéter.

This was a really great beer. Pours an unfiltered dark brown, almost black. Lots of dried fruit, malt, and brown sugar aromas going on. Big flavor, rich and robust but the abv is well hidden. I was really impressed with this brew. It definitely is reminiscent of some of the fine trappist beers.

Pretty spectacular beer. Pours a deep, murky reddish brown. Very nice aromas of dried fruit, apple, and caramel. Raisins and prune flavours, a touch of sour cherry. Hops, booze, and maybe some coffee too. Totally awesome.

Bottle from latest vintage (2012). Thanks to me. Intense malty/red fruity aromas emanate from this deep brown brew. It is topped by a small but persistent head that leaves some heavy lacing. Taste-wise is it malty but not cloyingly so. Flavors of plums, malt, chocolate and bread make the experience so complete. This is a world league quad, one that should be respected and I echo the brewers wish that it should be aged for at least six months as I just experienced empirically!
Smak och doft av karamell, trä, hounug, marsipan, madiera. Mycket kolsyra, oljig i konsistensen med portvinskaraktär. Mycket god och sammansatt.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 
34,1 cl bottle @ OHaras Freehouse. Rated on 05.03.2010
Aroma has raisins, ripe fruits, malty notes and some brown sugar. Flavour is sweetish with raisins, ripe fruits, caramel, malty notes and hints of brown sugar. Warming alcohol in the finish. Feels very Belgian for a Canadian beer. Probably the best quad outside Belgium.

8+4+7+3+16=3.9


34,1 cl bottle @ home, bottled 03/2013
Aroma is quite light with bready malt, toffee and ripe fruits. Flavour has sweet and ripe fruits, alcohol, some licorice and toffee. Finishes with warming alcohol. Quite close to Belgian ones. Not as good as I remembered, the alcohol tries to ruin the show here.
7+3+7+3+16=3.7
DDC is always great.  Really rich robust flavorful quad with little to no evidence of the 10.5% abv.  Lightly sweet and very nutty and raisiny.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours translucent medium brown with small off-white head.  Little lacing, thick body, medium/low carbonation, and light malt aroma.  Taste is fairly complex rich caramel, molasses, some light herbal hops, and a hint of alcohol.  Alcohol is pretty well covered, pretty easty to drink for the style, but hoped from more dark fruit.  Better as it warms.

7th June 2011Cloudy brown beer, small off white head. Light dry palate. Dry lactose sweetness. Whisper of chocolate. Trace of spice. Subtle sweet generic fruit. Finishes with more chocolate and a little spice. Decent.

Tastes like oatmeal raisin cookies with an intense sweet malty flavor and a signature Belgian carbonation that tickles the tongue. Drank from a tulip glass poured from a bottle. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the 11.5 fl. oz. bottle with no dates or other markings that I can see.  The pour is a dark brown with pretty good clarity.  The aroma is powerful with dark barley malts, brown sugar, molasses, bread, yeast, and a little booze. The body is medium to bold. The taste is very much like a barleywine with its sweetness and potent malty character with a solid bitterness announcing itself loudly at the end.  I should cellar another one and try it a year from now.

14/12/2012 on tap @ GEIB (Vintage 2010). Color miele di castagno, un po spenta, con schiuma leggera, quasi assente, e poco persistente. Al naso sentori di malto caramellato, cioccolato, alcol, mela matura, ossidata. In bocca alcol, tanto alcol, caramello, zucchero di canna e frutta matura. Corpo medio-pieno, carbonazione leggera. Non in perfette condizioni, lalcol si sente troppo.
Bouteille de 341ml, robe brune presque noire, arôme de petits fruits, goût également de petits fruits et de levure.

de couleur ambrée elle un gout malt roti avec un gout alcool qui vient equlibre le gout chaque gorge et mielleuse et on n a toujours le gout d en reprendre elle est divine par temps froid elle va vous rechauffe
Bottle. Pours a dark brown. Aroma is malt and peppery. Flavor is a great blend of malts and finishes very well for the abv. Nice and interesting pepper profile.

2007 bottle drank this year the time in bottle did it well. I didnt think this brew would do well with age but it did. It turned from a good brew to a great brew. Well worth the wait. All the heat melted away and all the flavored stayed. Great sipping brew

[bottled on 11/11]
Peppery phenolic aroma coupled with pleasant estery notes--difficult to pick apart. Hazy ruddy amber under a lasting tawny tan flannel blanket. Sweet caramel/amber malt in good balance with phenolic and estery profile and medium bitterness. Accents of salted peanuts and dried apricots. Medium to full body, moderate to medium carbonation, sweet and bitter finish.

thanx to i believe belgbeergeek for this one, on BBF 12
smells little sourness, 
taste more like a so called  vlaams oud bruin ale ( likes of rodenbach, aardmonnik, ...)  with some sweetness ( sugar, honey) to it. not sure how this is a quad...

Rewelacyjne piwo, wspaniale odwzorowany trapistowski styl. Zacznę od zapachu. Świeżo pieczone bułeczki, drożdżowy aromat. Wygląd intensywnie czarny z lekką przeświatą czerwieni, piana kremowa. W smaku palący słód miesza się z pikantnością użytych przypraw. Na finiszu rozgrzewajązy alkochol. Piwo doskonałe.

Really liked this beer, I look forward to trying other Dieu du Ciel brews.

I liked that it had all the qualities of a trappist beer in the aroma, without the heavy tar-like quality of some of those beers. I liked the lighter, red fruit feel.
Pours a deep red brown with a thin beige head. Complex leathery nose. Medium body with a malt, chocolate, datk fruit followed by caramel flavour.

11.5oz bottle. Only a 9 is notched in the date label. Dark red / brown color, little light khaki head, good spray of lace. Wow, big spice aroma, dark fruit that you might expect takes a back seat. Definite chocolate, some caramel, more cinnamon. Bigger body, but not thick and viscous. More of a dry texture, with good lighter carbonation, and a nice long rich spicy aftertaste. Little light khaki head, leaves some lace. Very enjoyable one to sip, definitely stands out
Pours a dark brown copper color. Aroma is chocolate, dark fruit and alcohol. Taste is a nice complex beer with fruit, yeast, malt, and alcohol. But at 10.5% its expected and i like it, great beer.

Bottle: Poured a reddish brown with a thin Gelatin beige color head that swashed about the top. Aroma is sticky fruit, lots of sweet caramel malt, and spice. Taste is very sticky dark fruit that subsides to reveal caramel malts and sugar.

I still cannot decide if I find the label to be tacky and bad or pleasing and nice - perhaps even I shall never decide / know. 341 ml bottle sampled @ Borefts 2012 - thx to Vincent I think but not entirely certain. First one from the brewery. Hazy brown with a tanned head on the sides. Smells of sugar, moldy oranges, aged hops, herbal, dark fruits. Dark old fruits, sweet herb, rather odd Belgian yeast, candy sugar, moldy fruits and herbs, toffee - bit murky body - pretty weird stuff.It is supposed to be a Belgian, it is unusual but I do not find it entirely bad - it is not stellar either. Kind of enjoyed - a rather puzzling beer for me - at least clearly different from what I have had up until now which is defiantly a positive thing for me.
Dirty brown body, offwhite head. Aroma of raisins, chocolate, vinous fruits, cookie dough. Flavour has raisin cookies, bit apricot, plums, dried fruits, caramel, very tight but Nice alcohol.
Aroma of roasty caramel-chocolate malt. Pours murky brown with minimal head and tastes strongly of malt similar to a porter but with more alcohol. Full-bodied with lively carbonation.

En fût au 14e anniversaire de DDC. Vintage 2009. Couleur brun ambré, mousse beige riche. Arôme de fruits confits, de prunes, de mélasse et dalcool. Ces arômes se révellent être les mêmes au goût en plus dune chaleur dalcool très agréable. Texture collante, carbonation faible.

A clear brown colored beer, wih a light beige head.The aroma of fruits, hop bitters with sweet. The taste of dark fruits, hop bitters and some spices. The aftertaste has dark fruits with bitter notes and some caramel.

Alcohol dominated unfortunately :( Corn kernel? Poorly burned sugar? Um? Nothing positive to say about this particular bottle. Could I be tasting an off bottle? This is simply terrible, with a long finish of alcohol and burned candy corn kernel... Hate to give a bad review, though this was just plain bad.. Just being honest. Personally, I wouldn't spend $6 to try again to see if there is bottle variation. Sorry. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 341 ml bottle. BB 2012-09-30. From Systembolaget, Malmö, Sweden. 
Brown colour with tiny greyish beige head.
Malt, dark fruits, raisins and alcohol in aroma.
Strong flavour of malt, caramel, toffee, dark fruits and raisins.
Complex and balanced. This one was bought 2009.

Bottle. Cloudy dark brown body with beige head that diminishes to light film. Aroma honey,dark fruits, chocolate notes and spiceness of yeast. Taste dates, caramel, and dark chocolate lingers on tongue with slight burn.
From notes. 12oz bottle, nice pour and foamy head. Nice balance of yeasty bread, malts and alcohol.
High alcohol and ceramic aroma. Light brown, infiltered color. Trappist ale with lots of malts and sweet fruits. Thick, tannin taste at the back of my mouth as I swallow.
341ml bottle. Deep dark brown colour with a froth of tan foam. Spiced fruit aroma with currants and plums in the flavour. Sits well in the mouth with a long finish.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. A cloudy dark bronze one with a small heavy lacing beige creamy head. It smells light sweet and almost woody, some fruits here as well and there is a hint of yeasty melon. Somewhat subtle, but nice! Lively carbonated and it has a light sweet and sticky texture. Its also light sweet in flavor, caramel sticky and I get some dark dried berries here. Oh yeah, this I can like! Some raisins and figs, also a bit of honey before it ends mild peppery and alcoholic. Yummy! 12.05.2012
I absolutely love this beer and this brewery! This along with Péché Mortel and Aphrodisiaque have been standouts within there styles and they are some of my favorite beers.

Poured from a bottle into a brandy snifter. Pours a dark brown with not much head. The aroma is chocolatey and caramelly with some yeasty influences and esters going on. Taste is sweet and a little boozy at first. As the beer warms, though, it opens up to a well rounded beer without being too alcoholic.

341 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Hailfax).  Pours a murky darkish brown with a hint of orange and a small tan head.  Aroma is toffee, candied brown sugar and dark fruit.  Flavour is sweet brown sugar, toffee, plum, raisin and a modest spiciness, even a little woodiness.  Alcohol is apparent but quite subtle for 10+%.  Certainly merits real respect.
Dark abbey-style beer that has hints of fruit. However, it has a forceful texture. Great beer for winter months, not so much in the summer
Dark ruby color with a small beige head. Aroma of dark fruits and caramel. Taste of dark fruits and some yeast and alcohol. Warming finish.
