Id had this in the fridge for over a year and was suprised how smooth it was. Left quite a sticky feel afterwards but tasted great. good beer
bottle bought at dutchs. poured murkey brown with off white head. big malt and maple aroma. taste was medium thick with a nice brown sugar finish definetly did not taste like a 10% beer.
Bottle to snifter (thanks mikem409).  Looks good; dark and boozy.  Tastes nice; sweet and boozy with a good mouthfeel.  ABV is subdued nicely.  Good stuff.

Bottle-oddly twist off: caramel brown with thin off-white head. Boozy nose with brown sugar, molasses, malt and candied fruits. Flavor of dusty malt, sweet brown sugar, caramel, molasses, bread and dough with a touch of toffee and a little clove. Palate is silky, sticky sweet with a punch of alcohol and a light spicy tingle. At first overly sweet but flavors start to gel better as it warms.

Smells like alcohol, raisins and sweet plum. Decent lacing and head retention.  A little cloying and viscous on the palate, taste stays with you. The taste has sweetness and bitter, consecutively, and some more alcohol on the finish. Good. Bottle from Peluso.

Exceptional aromas with notes of field berries like cherry, strawberry, raspberry and a touch of anise. Caramel is backing up all these aromas and we can also find a touch of cinnamon and crystallized fruits.
Appearance: Standard brown ale, blurred, with almost no head.
Flavors: A field berry explosion, very well balanced with a warm caramel. A strong alcohol is wrapping all flavors giving a wonderful round texture and a full body. We also find wood (oak) notes. Balance of flavors is extremely complex. We can easily find 7 or 8 different flavors in there. Another great beer by Dieu du Ciel. Il ne manque pas grand chose pour pouvoir se comparer aux grandes bières trapistes.

I enjoyed the mixing of the abbey and brown ale styles. I did not think it would pan out at first. The smell isnt the greatest but it intrigued me and is better than most. The magic of this brew is in the taste. The two styles fit together well but hold their own. You can taste a little of each. I thought all of the flavor would have been jumbled leaving an odd or putting off taste. I am glad I was wrong.
Pours a brown colour with a thin head aroma is caramel malts brown and Candi sugar. Flavour is very smooth light caramel and chocolate mild bitterness and light alcohol notes

A minor disappointment considering its reputation. Too "hot" and not full enough in figure to carry that much alcohol with any grace. Must be heaps better on tap? Translucent redwood in colour with a thin corona. Super-sweet, highly-perfumed floral aroma: Parma Violet sweeties, faint ginger and grape bubblegum.  Lovely creamy body but its not sturdy enough for this weight of alcohol. In the mouth, its sweet and under-attenuated. Winey with some souring summer fruits and a hot finish. Acidic and just too darn alcoholic imo. I like strong beers but I like the booze to sink in like a stiletto, rather than a cosh. (347ml bottle from Leura Cellars. Bottled 4/10)

7/7/12. Bottle shared at my going away tasting by colemanzuber! Hazy amber pour with a small khaki head. Slightly sweet aroma of brown sugar and dark fruits. Light sugary taste with brown sugar, dark fruits, and a hint of oxidation. Not bad - surprisingly smooth given the ABV.
What a beer. Doesnt have all that much aroma, some crispness and spice. This is really quite tasty. Doesnt taste anywhere near as strong as it is. Until you stand up, that is. Excellent stuff.

Solid quad from a respectable Canadian brewery. Pours a nice dark nut brown with a short head, leaves a bit of yeast at the bottom of the glass. Smells of dark fruit and candi sugar behind the maltiness. Tastes of rasins, cassis, spice and caramel. Not too carbonated, sweet and definitely full-bodied. Ill be ageing some bottles to see how they hold up in 6 months to a year!
En knappt tre år gammal flaska med härlig madieradrag. Lite syrlig som matchar sötman väl. Stod sig väldigt bra mot en något äldre Rochefort 10. Fantastisk god.

Dark amber/cider color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of malt, yeast, dark fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, dark fruit (notably plums), raisons, caramel, and spice; Finish has some pepper notes and alcohol; Nicely balanced and complex; Pretty good.

Ive been aging this beer for many months. Pours brown/copper. Not much foam. Aroma: bread, cereal, lightly toasted caramel. Beer served in a wide opened glass (Westmalle), aromas were a bit hard to identify. Taste: madium sweetness, light bitter, full body. Caramel, toast, nut, medium bitterness. Palate: carbonation soft, long finish. Really great beer.

Pours dark murky brown with light tan head and some lace. Aroma is light spiciness and smoke, alcohol as it warms. Taste lots of spice, light smoke, sweet malts, alcohol. Palate is medium, lively on tongue, finish long spice, dark chocolate.

11.5oz bottle - pours murky amber with creamy tan head and decent lacing.  Nose is basement aromas.  Flavor adds alcohol, raisin, caramel, candy sugar and fruity.  Taste is sweet with a hint of sourness.  Medium body with dry finish.  Burning mouthfeel.  Easy to drink for an ABT, but the alcoholic content forces me to sip it.  Burp.  Not impressed.

Pours a nutty chocolate brown with tan tinged head. Aroma is a mix of oak, dark chocolate, almond and molasses. Flavor is almond, brown sugar, vanilla, chocolate and coffee. Palae is light yet filling with a lot of vcarbonation.

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2012. Hazy dark amber with small tan head. Aroma is malt, fruit, dried fruits, yeas, caramel and toffee. Flavour is malt, fruit, dried fruits, yeast, caramel, medium sweet, toffee with notes of alcohol.

Rusty copper colour with haze. Aroma isnt very strong, but there is some raisin and toffee notes coming through. Flavour hgas carmalized sugar, toffee, raisin and some alcohol on the back. Slick mouth feel with some heat on the finish.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2012 Bottled. Pours hazy orangy amber with a small tan head. Nose of dark roasted malt and spicy notes. Sweet flavor with fruit, caramel and notes of spice and yeast. Medium to full bodied, oily to creamyy texture and medium to soft carbonstion. More dryf inish with warming alcohol. A world class beer.

Bottle. Murky brown pour with sediment - creamy ring head. Nose is slightly sour fruit (apple) and a touch of malt. Moderate palate. Taste is almost sour-like - not too much sour, but its there for sure. Fig/raisin and spice in the taste as well. Good stuff, but I was hoping for a little more out of this one.

Bottle 341 ml. This beer had been aged for five months. It says on the bottle that it reaches its peak at six or more, but an "accident" forced me to drink it earlier than I expected. Still, it was pretty amazing. It pours a nice dark brown with a beautiful medium beige head. Not much lacing tough. Aroma is great, very rich:caramel, belgian yeasts, malt, red fruits, spices and even some honey. Taste is pretty much the same. Sweet and well balanced. No bitterness at all. Some warming alcohol but not overwhelming. Full bodied beer. Really nice, but you must wait for it to reach its potential!
CBC. Hazy reddish brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit and a little alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 120512

Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours golden with a offwhite head. Aroma of malt, belgium yeast, sweets, fruity, plums. Taste is sweet bready malt, caramel, some yeast, sweet dark fruits, raisins and plums. Medium body, lively carbonation. 120512

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Pours a dark cognac brown body with a small off-white head. Aroma is red fruity tones, wood, caramel and hints of toffee. Taste is fruity herbal tones, honey, heather, hints of caramel, candi sugars, wood and red grapes. Full body, sligthly dry and woody aftertaste. Unusual in its take on the Quad style, this is a real "off-piste" brew but somehow doesnt go all the way for me. Nice enough, though.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2014 Cola brown, hazy translucent, tan film of head.  Smells of astringent grass, hints of sweet caramel.  Body is thin and bubbly, slightly boozy, a spicy but not over-the-top yeast contribution.  Although there was no explosion upon opening, I believe this beer has gone bad... the second time this has happened from the same vendor.  Some redeeming attributes come through in the aftertaste, but overall its a pretty big disappointment (particularly in the aroma.)   ... yeah, thats real shame, Ive been looking forward to trying this beer for a long time.  I am dumping about 90% of this beer :(  Im giving it a 12 for overall impression because I think it would be good if not mistreated/infected (the former is more likely given the lack of over carbonation)

UPDATE (2 yrs later): Muddy warm brown-red, thin fine tan head, aroma of apple, raisin, and brown sugar.  Flavor: apple, brown sugar, raisin, and astringent bitter aftertaste.  What is it with this beer. I think this is the intended flavor, but I suspect its just not a match for my palate.  Light body, medium, smooth carbonation.  Pretty good, would be great but for the aftertaste.
Tap at CBC. Pours dark amber with small tan head. Aroma is dark fruits, figs, malts, sugar. Taste is like aroma. Some alcohol. Nice!
CBC 2012, Copenhagen. Red/brown beer with abeige head. Fruity, malty aroma. Malty, brown sugar, raisins, fruity flavour.

Deep reddish brown with a one-finger tan head and nice lacing. Rich dark fruit aromas with candy sugar, malt, and hints of molasses and alcohol. Caramel malt seetness accompanied by chocolate, figs, raisins, and yeast notes. Warming alcohol becomes more prominent as the beer warms. Medium to full body, moderate carbonation, sticky mouthfeel, and a long sweet finish. Improved dramatically as it warmed.
Tap at CBC. Hazy orange colour with a small off-hire head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, caramel and spice.

CBC 2012. Pours cloudy orange amber with a small beige head. Aroma is malty fruity raisins fidges vineous and a bit bready. Flavor is sweet fruity raisins spicy a bit pungent and alcohol keeping the sweetness all the way to the end. Finishes sweet and fruity with longlived bitterness.

Bottle 341 ml. Pours dark orange-brown with a thin beige. Some lacing. Aroma is sweet with strong notes of dark fruits, spices, malt, berries and raisin. Taste is sweet with malt, red fruits, spices and caramel. Warming (!) alcohol. This beer a good abt, but alcohol may be a little too overwhelming right now. Could benefit from at least a couple of month of aging.

Light brown, small film of light foam.
Sweet candy and some nutty malty notes. Hints of the belgian yeasts 
Malty sweet with yeasty notes. Dark fruits in the back.
Murky amber/burnt golden. Small white/off-white head. Some lacing. Nice malty base with some dark fruit. Slight alcohol. But balance. Nice beer.

12-MAY-2012, draft @CBC.
Unclear amber with lasting beige head.
Typical quad. Fruity malty with figs, dried fruit...
Fine body and carbonation. 
Fine brew.
Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2012. Somewhat hazy golden beer, nice beige head. Fruity vinous aroma, figs, yeast, bready notes. Bready vinous flavor, spicy notes, fruity, grapes, raisins, some alcohol.

Pours a nice dark brown with a short tab head, has a nice smooth alcohol taste as well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the bottle... Pours a burnt umber color with a small slightly tan head that dissipate quickly.  Rich aromas of caramel, plum, figs and a touch of earthy hops.  The flavors are rich and creamy; caramel, burnt sugar, dried blueberry and a bit of dark chocolate fruity bitterness on the end.  My bottle is dated 11/11 and Im not getting much heat or alcohol... seems to have mellowed out on the shelf and is an easy drinker for a 10.5%abv.

(11.5 oz. from Tullys) Pours murky darkish brown with just a trace of head. Aroma of fruit, light chocolate, even lighter caramel. Mouthfeel fairly smooth, medium full. Flavor of chocolate, fruit and light yeast, a little boozy. Good, but not terribly complex, maybe needs more time?

Ho boy, this is as fine an abbot as youll find. Poured at a great temperature with a small to medium sized, tan head that soon settled to a light swirl and a little lace. Color is a hazy dark copper with a couple of bubble trails. Aroma is malt, bread dough, yeast, dark ripe fruit, toffee. Flavors much like nose and has excellent balance between a little hop/malt bitter, plenty of yeast bitter, carbonic tang, and sweet. Interestingly  sweet seems to fade a bit. Body and carbonation are spot on. Finish is like flavor, boozy, and long. Superior beer.

Bottle shared with friends.  Brown pour with a tiny tan head.  Sugary sweet aroma with dark fruits, caramel, malt and some banana.  Sweet caramel flavour with the dark fruits in the background.  Some banana and chocolate also comes through.  Full bodied with low carbonation.

Brown pour, 1/2 finger of white head that fizzes out immediately.  Small patches of lacing.  Aroma of dried dark fruit, raisin, plum, fig, brown sugar and yeast.  Dark fruit up front, clove, allspice, light molasses.  Medium body, low carbonation.  Very good but something small lacking that keeps this from being great.

Dark brown bear with hardly any carbonation resulting in only a tiny thin layer of foam. Strong alcohol aroma and taste. Candy sugar, slightly spiced, dark fruits (prums and rasins). The alcohol is to strong making it a bit unbalanced. Still a good beer.
This beer is awesome ! Had the chance to drink a 2009 3 months ago, was really tasty, nice dark robe. Awesome taste, this is the kind of beer that is almost perfect for me !

Pour is a murky thick brown with almost no head at all.  Aroma is sweet bread, brown sugar and alcohol.  Flavor is a big molasses, dark fruit and candi sugar.  Finish has a little earthy oak left on the tounge.  Probably not as complex as its Belgian counter parts but its heavy, sugary, fruity and boozy.  Not bad for a bargan bin pick up.

34cl bottle. Pours a dark amber/brownish color with a small beige head. Aroma is deep and malty. Sweetish with prunes, molasses, caramel and figs. Little alcohol. Taste is similar and mostly sweetish. Dried fruits, figs, caramel and some wood. Booze as well. Full bodied with good carbonation. Overall, quite complex and tasty, a very good example of the style imo.

A damn good beer. Thought Id had this one before, but after tasting it, I changed my mind. Pours out a dark murky brown, opaque throughout with a thin beige head. Beautiful beige lacing rings around the glass. The nose is sweet and boozy with a big chocolate and roasted barley malt. Notes of prune, dirt, chocolate, raisin and a light hop note. Simply sublime nose. The middle has a sweet, nutty malt with big toffee and fruit notes. A dry finish with big prunes and raisins and a lovely roasted malt throughout. A bit unique and different from a Belgian Quad, specifically the yeasty notes are a bit different. Regardless, this is an awesome Abt!

Bière brune voilée ayant un léger col mousseux qui réapparaît à chaque fois quon remue le verre. Des arômes très agréables de grains grillés, de miel de sarrasin, de caramel, dépices et de levure en émanent. Goût dalcool qui est équilibré par une palette épicée, particulièrement par la cannelle ou encore la muscade avec des pointes, ici et là, fruitées, qui rappellent un peu la figue séchée ou encore les dattes iraniennes. Très belle surprise.(186-140312)

Very dark pour with minimal carbonation. This beer completes me (MK). Clean mouthfeel maybe a little thin

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a beautiful ruby red with very little head, makes way to white lacings. Aroma, grape, raisin, very creamy, mildly oily on the palate. Wonderful beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

341ml bottle from Broue Ha Ha, have had this a few times but finally got around to rating it. Hazy brown with a nice dark biege head that fades to a thin layer. Great aroma - dark yeast (if that makes sense) and fruit, some fresh bread, somewhat sweet malts, alcohol, slightly burnt caramel. Very smooth, full body, moderate to high carbonation, sweet but not overwhelming, lots of yeast with caramel and some vanilla. A mellow finish, carries through on the aroma, very tasty.

Date: February 28, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: Discount Description: Opaque muddy brown pour with minimal head.  Aroma of dark fruit, yeast/bread and some alcohol.  Taste was heavy on the alcohol, then caramel and dark fruit took a back seat.  Not as smooth as I was expecting and would prefer, but maybe some more age would do this well.

Yeast, bread, fruit, spice, and a little alcohol in the aroma.  Sweet flavor with same fruit, bread, and spice.  Finish isnt as smooth as some of the classic ABTs out there, with a fair alcohol bite.  Still a great beer, though.

Pours a murky dark brown with minimum head, aroma of dark fruit, yeast, bread & cocoa. flavors of grape, port, nuts,caramel & chocolate, this beer is smooth, mellow & well balanced. lightly carbonated with a slight warming sweet finish, I put this one down for 2 years before opening and it was worth the wait, I wish I had purchaced a case of this beer,Yummy!

pours a dark murky brown hue with a small light brown head that is mostly diminishing
aroma is of drk fruits, molasses and brown sugar - pretty boozy as well
flavor is the same with some malt at the end......
thick mouthfeel with lively carbonation
Arôme de caramel, faible mousse, effervescente. Goût assez prononcé dalcool, un arrière-goût amer.

3-month old 341 ml bottle. Pours a foggy brown with a pale beige head. Smells of caramel. Tastes of caramel, dry fruits, dates and sweet cream.Nice bitter finish with a distinctive booze feel. Alcohol remains for a few moments, but it tends to be forgotten after a few sips. Very good, but I felt the alcohol was a bit too present, maybe next time I try one, Ill let it age 6 months like they suggest on the bottle.

11.5oz btl. marked 0 5.  Pours cloudy light brown with a sexy thin head leaving light lacing.  This beers colder than I would prefer which dampens the aroma but still has a sweet malt sugary light vanilla nose.  Tastes vibrant up front mellowing to candied sugars, light tartness from the yeast, smooth mild chocolate flavor and finishes with a bit of alcohol.  For this beer... it will pack your bags for you because its going to take you for a ride.

12oz bottle brought back from Igloofest wkend in Mtl. Awesome, mirky, muddy yellow-brown pour with a heavy load of sediment that hangs in suspension. Aroma is funky, yeasty and malty. Flavor is rich with belgian yeast, malt and a spicy sort of funk. Some caramel. Really full-bodied and complex. Not a huge aftertaste at all.

341ml bottle pours a reddish brown color with a small off-white head that leaves a few spots of lacing.  Aroma is dark fruits and chocolate with hints of yeast.  Taste is a roasted malty bitterness with some chocolate and dark fruit sweetness and hints of yeast and mild hops.  This beer is quite complex and hides the alcohol quite well and is nicely balanced.  Highly recommended.

Strong beer with some some dominant tastes of caramel, alcohol and malt yet some subtle tastes filtering through as well. It is very smooth for a 10.5% ABV beer. If one drinks it fast it leaves a strong but pleasant impression though maybe a bit sweet. If one drinks it slow one can appreciate the fine tastes contained within this beer.
Une tonne de pruneaux, figues et dattes caramélises. Le chocolat simbrique subtilement dans le profil également. La finition est assez sèche. Un classique qui mérite de dormir dans le cellier.

[Rated 06/29/2010] Bottle. Pours caramel brown with a thin head that quickly dissolves. Aroma is of raisins and honey with some grapefruit maybe. It has a flavor of honey with grapefruit bitterness, maybe some spices. Not a bad beer, but not quite for my palate.

11.5 ounce bottle into chalice, batch 15(or something).  Pours cloudy dark brown color with a small light khaki head with good retention that reduces to a thin cap.  Some small bits of lacing on the glass.  Aromas of big plums, molasses, chocolate, caramel, candi sugar, bread, raisins, and a bit of yeast spices and light alcohol.  Very nice and well balanced aromas.  Taste of big chocolate, caramel, biscuit, toasted malt, molasses, dark fruit, herbal spiciness, pepper, and spicy alcohol.  Lingering notes of chocolate, caramel, molasses, dark fruit, and a bit of alcohol on the finish.  Medium carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a fairly creamy mouthfeel.  Drinkability is limited due to some booziness but it is a pretty nice sipper.  Alcohol is noticeable, but not too bad.  Overall this is a pretty nice Quadrupel.  Some good flavor complexity and balance.  If it was a bit less boozy I probably would have liked it more.

Bottle. Pours a dark clear red with an offwhite head. Smells of raisin, toffee. Tastes intensely of brown sugar and roasted malt. Heavy sweetness, with a medium tartness of dried red berries, and some peppery aftertaste. Medium body. Light to medium carbonation. Sugary smooth texture. Finishes sweet with raisins.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 Bottle in tulip glass. Dark brown colour with off white head. Gorgeous beer. Aroma is fruity and malty. Taste is malt, dried fruit, a slight touch of bitterness in the finish. Stands up very well to the great trappist ales.

Bottled. Thanks Noize for sharing. The aroma has raisins, some chocolate, fruitiness, caramel. Hazy, dark amber coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is little sweet, has raisins, dark fruits, spices. Warming beer. Very nice.

12 oz bottle.  I pretty much love everything from these guys.  Pours black as night body, low carbonation head.  Darker fruits and some cocoa in the nose, but an underlying sweetness that I dont like in Quads.  Mouthfeel is good, sweet and cloying a bit, overpowering concentrated fruits and a honey sweetness.  Finishes long, but not very balanced.  I can see enjoying this on a cold night when your in the mood for it, otherwise, id say sit on it and see what time does.
Sweet malt aroma with a light hops aroma and hints of clove. Sweet taste with flavors of malt, caramel, fruit, yeast and alcohol. A nice beer to sip on!

Pours deep brown with a thin beige head.  Aromas are malty, banana and chocolate.  Sweet tasting with heavy malty flavors.  Doughy yeast flavor carries through for a satisfying finish.  Had this cellared for the better part of a year - alcohol flavor mellowed significantly compared to the first bottle I tried.

Bottle 33cl from Mondial de la Bière. An amber dark beer with head that goes quickly. Nose is complex on anise, cinnamon, chocolate, yeast, over ripes fruit. Aroma is on banana, fig and spices with an amazing licorice and chocolate body, syrupy and sweet, slight smoked notes. Wahhhh this creamy licorice and malt body is lovely, the 10° are even not detectable, finish is smooth and tasty with peppery hops, great brew !

Appearance:  dark brown, almost cola-like pour, with reddish amber highlights and a khaki head and some shimmering lace.   Aroma: chocolate, caramel, loads of brown sugar, plums, cherries raisins and figs, a bit of booze.   Taste: milk chocolate, pie crust, cherry liqueur, raw brown sugar, port, prune juice, hint of cinnamon and clove.   Finish: tingly, yeasty, spicy, with lingering roasty chocolate notes and gentle, boozy warmth.   Notes: Smelled and tasted like nothing so much as a chocolate cherry pie.  Booziness was restrained.  Flavors were rich and sweet.  Palate was syrupy, yet the yeasty spice and good carbonation kept it pretty drinkable and clean in the mouth.  Solid.
Clear Rich brown color with a medium head. Aromas of cassonade, licorice, fruits and spices. Strong sweet taste with strong presence of alcohol.

Bottle; Pour is murky gold/brown with an off white head in this glass - retention is average - eventually ringing the glass; light lacing is present here. The nose is dark fruits, caramel, chocolate, and cinnamon. The flavor profile is more on the spicy side out of the gate; dark fruits, caramel, chocolate, molasses, pepper, cinnamon, with some warming alcohol character near the finish. This was a nice one, for sure.
Draft. Drank a pint of this delicious liquid. Very interesting beer. Nice appearence, sweet taste.

341ml brown bottle. Bottled 04/10. Dark brown pour, deep orange-amber highlights, looks fairly clear. Tan head, a good 2 fingers in height on first pour, then settles to a nice light creamy covering on the surface. Frothy lacing. Nose has sweet chocolate malt with a light suggestion of coffee, some alcohol and yeast spiciness. In the mouth, lots of strong dark malt character - dark chocolate like malts with that almost coffeeish edge, plenty of sweetness, some plummy fruit notes. Ends with some bitterness and some alcoholic notes and also a hint of yeast. Roasty, chocolateish fade out. Soft mouthfeel, gentle natural carbonation. Full in body. Great abt with nice malts and moderate alcohol character. Will try aging some to see if the alc fades a bit. Still a winner.

A - Pours a rich deep brown color with a bit of red mixed in and a thin layer of frothy brownish colored head. The thin layer hangs around for quite some time lacing nicely as it finally fades.

S - Aroma is a mix of sweet candi and brown sugar and caramel malts. There is a bit of dark fruit and some clear yeast character. The booze is also noticeable.

T - Starts off with a mix of rich sweet candi sugar and caramel malts. There just a bit of sweet dark fruit and spice in the background. Through the middle, the booze comes through a bit alongside some yeast flavor and banana. The finish is a mix of yeast, sweet caramel and sugar, and some booze that lingers.

M - Full bodied with mild carbonation. Feels slick with a bit of a syrupy feel and some warming from the alcohol.

D - Very drinkable. The caramel malts and candi sugar provide a nice rich and sweet base to the beer with the fruitiness and yeasts providing some additional flavors.

Review ported from BA

Appearance:
Wow, no head on this at all. It attempted to foam a bit, but really just didnt happen. The color is a misty, translucent brown which reminds me of pretty much every lighter brown ale Ive ever seen.

Smell:
Bready maltiness is what Im really getting here. Banana notes have a moderate presence, with no hops aroma. Its not a complex smell, but it feels fitting of the beer.

Taste:
heavy banana bread taste and possible oatmeal flavor. Toasted malts give it a complexity which I didnt expect from the smell. Semi-sweet, with just a tinge of hops. A bit of alcohol heat to it, but not so much as to overpower the other flavors.

Mouthfeel:
Very heavy, very full. Medium-low carbonation. Has kind of an oily texture. Reminds me kind of how 120 minute IPA feels, strangely enough.

Overall:
This is an interesting beer, and I can certainly enjoy it. Its a solid offering from a brewery which creates quite a few very good beers.

I poured a dark brown, semi-floculent brew with about an inch of tan pillowy foam which dissipated rather quickly. Smells like figs, banana, alcohol, a bit of chocolate. The flavor is some lightly sweet fruit, some semi-sweet chocolate and caramel, as it warms the fruit subsides and more rounded caramel and mild roasty bitterness appears. Mouthfeel is slightly syrupy, a full palate for sure, with soft carbonation. Its delicious and I never would have guessed it came from north of the border. This brewer needs some press so Canada can get beyond Labat and Molson.
Pours dark red into a 300ml glass from Bar Volo on tap. notes of dark ripe fruit, fairly sweet and incredibly delicious.

11.5 ounce bottle purchased a year ago at Holiday Wine Cellar ($5.79).  Pours a muddy brown hue with significant blood red highlights and one finger of beige head.  Aroma of caramel, cherry, dark fruit, significant spice, and a hint of anise.  Big malty flavors of thick sticky caramel, smooth chocolate, raisin bread, and dark fruit.  Nice level of sweetness and complexity.  Syrupy mouthfeel with some lingering caramel sweetness.  The high is ABV very well concealed.  Very nice quad.  (543, 611)

Bottle. Dark brown, hazy, small and fully diminishing head. Moderate, malty and sweet aroma, fruitiness with dark fruits and caramel, some alcohol and faint spiciness (coriander, pepper). Body is medium to full, malty and sweet flavor, fruitiness - dark fruits, some alcohol and spiciness with caramel. Finish is average to long, malty and sweetish, fruitiness and caramel, alcohol and some spiciness. Sweet and fruity strong ale with lots of (too much ) alcohol.

Its hard to overstate how good the beer these guys make generally is. Big massive malt sweetness up front. Caramel, maybe molasses, some chocolate. Alcohol burn is there, but it just feels right. Medium thick in the mouth with low carbonation.
Such a delicious beer, and I took the brewers suggestion and had it with some dark chocolate, really brought the two flavors together. A little abv burn, but not off putting.

Consumed at the hour of madness, stardate, NOW.  It happened.  The dark brown juice was drank, tasting of these alcohol soaked plums, rolled in dark cherry malts, epically singing your palate in the best way possible before swallowing.  Yes Sir May I have another!

Very good beer, taste mostley of caramelized pears, fudge, and raisins. Some more dried fruits and its rich and complex. Very well balanced, though the alcohol was well hidden for being a belgian style ale.

A very solid abt. Pours dark brown with an unusually small head for the type. Aroma is yeast, spices, brown sugar and dark dried fruits including raisins. Taste is sweet, with the alcohol clearly present. Theres a strong spicy presence as well. Body is fairly full, and the carbonation is stronger than the head suggests.
A really complex brew. Funky yeast flavour with dried fruit, spice and caramel.

Pours dark swampy orange with film of head that lingers.  Its a bottle about 16 months old.  Aromas: good.  Raisins, alcohol, maybe a bit of pepper?  Funky yeast, bread, grape, port, peat, candy etc.  Alcohol is present for sure but it lets the other aromas shine.  Smooth, mellow drink.  Contemplative.  Sweetness, bitterness in balance.  Touch of pleasant astringency.  Commendable.

Bottle. Hazy red-brown body with a large dense brown head. Excellent lacing. Aroma:taste of molasses, raw sugar, chocolate and dried fruits with a port like character. Significant background bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Nice.
